Additionally, as a reaction when a friendly creature within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can grant that creature resistance to the damage dealt by the attack. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Likely originated in Shurima, where currency was tied to celestial favor and desert survival.
DescriptionLore: This coin, likely originating from Shurima, feels warm to the touch and depicts imagery of the sun and desert. As an action, you can flip the coin. On a heads, for the next minute, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. On a tails, you can summon enough water to fill a single waterskin. Once the coin is flipped, it cannot be flipped again until the next dawn.

Lore: The Arcane Helix hums with Ionian spirit magic, resonating with the land's ancient energies and possibly influencing spirit blossom festivals.
DescriptionLore: This intricate helix pulses with arcane energy, resonating with the wild magic of the Feywild. While holding the helix, you gain advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks related to the Feywild or spirits. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the 'faerie fire' spell (save DC 15). The helix has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, the staff amplifies inner energies. It is rumored to resonate with the spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: This staff, crafted from a light, resonant wood, seems to hum with spiritual energy. While holding this staff, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can regain a number of hit points equal to the spell's level.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial Aspect of Magic, granting its wielder immense magical power and spiritual insight.
DescriptionLore: While holding this unholy grail, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the spell's level + your spellcasting ability modifier.

Lore: Associated with the Black Rose, granting its user immense power, but at a terrible cost. Could be related to forbidden hemomancy rituals.
DescriptionLore: When you cast a necromancy spell of 1st level or higher, roll a d6. On a 1, you take necrotic damage equal to the spell's level. Otherwise, the spell's damage or healing is increased by 2 for each of its dice and the range of the spell is doubled. This augment functions once per long rest.

Lore: Potentially created by a forgotten aspect of Targon, granting immense arcane power. It's linked to celestial beings enhancing mortals.
DescriptionLore: This celestial augment grants you advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks. As an action, you can expend a spell slot to gain a number of arcane power dice (d4s) equal to the spell slot's level +1. For the next minute, once per turn, you can add one of these dice to an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. Any unused dice are lost when the minute ends.

Lore: Associated with Ionian monasteries, used for meditation and healing rituals. Perhaps a connection to the Kinkou Order or the Wuju Style.
DescriptionLore: This bag contains rare Ionian tea leaves, imbued with subtle healing properties. As an action, you can brew a cup of tea and drink it. Doing so restores 2d4 hit points and grants advantage on Wisdom saving throws for 1 hour. The bag contains enough tea for 5 uses.

Lore: A common sidearm in Bilgewater, often enchanted for extra punch. Used by bounty hunters and gang members alike.
DescriptionLore: This cutlass, common in Bilgewater, is a magic weapon that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend one of its charges to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. The cutlass has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks and assassins, the Blink Dagger is rumored to be crafted with magic allowing for short-range teleportation.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can activate this dagger to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. The dagger can be used in this way three times, and regains all expended uses at dawn. If you are wearing light or no armor, the range of the teleport increases to 60 feet.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to contain blood magic, grants the wielder a shield based on damage dealt; possibly connected to Vladimir.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. Whenever you deal damage to a creature with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt, up to a maximum of 15. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once the shield grants temporary hit points, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by assassins. The necklace is rumored to contain the souls of those Rengar has hunted. Thus, it's influence waxes and wanes with each kill.
DescriptionLore: This necklace has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack, you can expend 1 charge to gain one of the following benefits: Advantage on your next attack roll against a creature, Resistance to one damage type until the end of your next turn, or increase your speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Simple footwear, common across Runeterra. But in Ionia, some believe even the road you walk shapes your destiny.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that would reduce your speed.

Lore: Likely crafted by a Hemomancer in Noxus, perhaps to sustain their power in combat, or to drain power from the enemies in order to grant it to its wielder.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (any), very rare (requires attunement). While wielding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to target one creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged on Targon, it is said to protect against celestial wrath, favored by the Solari for its protective properties.
DescriptionLore: Shield, very rare (requires attunement). While holding this shield, you have resistance to radiant damage and your AC increases by 2. As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by a spell or effect that deals radiant damage, you can grant advantage on the saving throw against that effect.

Lore: Favored by ambitious captains, this trinket whispers promises of swift voyages and plunder from distant shores.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement). While attuned to this trinket, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate at sea. Additionally, you can cast the spell 'Control Water' once per day. When you cast Control Water using this item, you can only choose to create a whirlpool or part the sea. You regain the ability to cast Control Water in this way at dawn.

Lore: Associated with the Crimson Circle, a secret society within Noxus known for their hemomancy and blood rituals.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this weapon, whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, you can cast the *Vampiric Touch* spell at 3rd level once per long rest without requiring material components. The weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit if you are below half your maximum hit points.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian monks seeking inner peace, it's rumored to be associated with the spirit realm and moments of perfect clarity.
DescriptionLore: This item grants advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Intelligence (Investigation) checks. Once per long rest, as an action, you can enter a meditative state for 1 minute. During this time, you gain truesight out to a range of 30 feet and resistance to psychic damage. Maintaining this state requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energies, offering solace and balance to its wielder, reminiscent of the Aspect of Harmony.
DescriptionLore: While holding this chalice, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can pour liquid into the chalice and imbue it with celestial energy. The next creature to drink the liquid gains the benefit of a *Greater Restoration* spell. Once used, this property of the chalice cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to be quenched in the blood of conquered foes, it imbues its wearer with burning strength.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to fire damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of heat in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Whispers say a master Ionian shadow dancer crafted these. Some link it to the conflicts surrounding the Kinkou Order.
DescriptionLore: While wearing the cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in dim light or darkness. The dagger is a +1 weapon. As a bonus action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet, leaving behind a shadowy image of yourself that lasts until the start of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins and those who delve into forbidden alchemy, it grants the drinker a temporary edge at a terrible price.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4+2 hit points, and you gain advantage on your next attack roll or saving throw within the next minute. For the next hour, you have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws and your maximum hit points are reduced by 5.

Lore: Whispers suggest the city's fall was due to a powerful Void incursion, leaving behind only echoes and this unsettling artifact.
DescriptionLore: This ancient Shuriman artifact hums with suppressed Void energy. While holding it, you can use an action to unleash a piercing shriek, forcing each creature within 30 feet to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Crafted with dark magic in the Shadow Isles, it is said to corrupt the wielder, drawing power from the souls of the dead.
DescriptionLore: This scythe pulses with necrotic energy, its touch chilling and corrupting. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this scythe, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's challenge rating (minimum of 1) for 1 minute. While you possess temporary hit points granted by this weapon, your alignment shifts one step closer to Chaotic Evil. This shift is subtle but cumulative; prolonged use may result in permanent alignment change at the DM's discretion.

Lore: Forged in the light of Targon, rumored to be connected to the Solari and their eternal conflict against the Lunari.
DescriptionLore: This radiant longsword is a symbol of the Solari, forged in the heart of Mount Targon. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit an undead or fiend with it, that creature takes an extra 2d8 radiant damage. As an action, you can cause the blade to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet for 1 minute. Undead and fiends have disadvantage on attack rolls while in the bright light. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists, its whirling blades are said to channel the spirits of past masters, enhancing agility and precision.
DescriptionLore: This elegant scimitar, a favored weapon of Ionian duelists, grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this blade, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and Dexterity saving throws. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Lore: This item seems to be associated with Ionian monks who are known for their movement techniques and spiritual attunement.
DescriptionLore: This amulet, attuned to Ionian spiritual practices, allows you to cast the Misty Step spell at will. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a charge (of which the amulet has 3, regaining all expended charges daily at dawn) to become invisible until the end of your next turn. While invisible in this way, your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

Lore: Said to be crafted by a wandering monk, seeking enlightenment, for disciples of his order. Perhaps connected to a forgotten spirit.
DescriptionLore: This intricately carved wooden idol, once held by a wandering monk, grants you advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you use your action to meditate with the idol for at least 1 minute, you regain 2d6 hit points.

Lore: Crafted from lost Freljordian ice magic, the shield whispers forgotten tales of the fallen Iceborn.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have resistance to cold damage. Additionally, as a reaction when you take cold damage, you can choose to empower the shield with the absorbed energy. The shield gains 1 charge, up to a maximum of 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 or more charges to unleash a wave of frozen energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 cold damage per charge spent on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save also have their speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

Lore: Forged by celestial artisans on Mount Targon, rumored to shatter nightmares and grant clarity in the face of oblivion.
DescriptionLore: This +3 longsword glows faintly when within 30 feet of a creature that is dreaming, whether naturally or magically. While wielding Dreamshatter, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can plunge Dreamshatter into the ground, creating a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you. For the next minute, all creatures within the sphere have advantage on saving throws against nightmares and effects that would cause them to have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

Lore: Named after Eleisa, a Demacian healer known for her compassion. Possibly associated with the Lightbringers, a monastic order devoted to healing.
DescriptionLore: This holy symbol can be used as a spellcasting focus for cleric and paladin spells. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DC of your cleric and paladin spells while using this item as a focus. Once per day, when a creature within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to cause them to regain 1d8 hit points. If this restores them to at least 1 hit point, they also gain advantage on the next saving throw they make before the end of their next turn.

Lore: Potent brew favored by Demacian artificers enhancing innovation, now outlawed due to volatile side effects.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this elixir, roll a d4. For the next hour, you gain a bonus to Intelligence checks and saving throws equal to the number rolled. Additionally, at the end of that hour, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Potent brew favored by Noxian siege engineers and demolitionists, known for its volatile enhancement of destructive capabilities.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this elixir, your destructive capabilities are amplified. For the next minute, your attacks deal an extra 2d6 force damage to objects and structures. Additionally, any critical hit you score against an object or structure causes a localized explosion. All creatures within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage, or half as much on a success.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, the Emblem of Valor is often used by soldiers needing to prove their loyalty and bravery to their leaders.
DescriptionLore: While you wear this emblem, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can present the emblem and steel your resolve. Until the end of your next turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and attack rolls against you have disadvantage.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, this item might have been used by a brutal warlord to suppress rebellions or enforce conscription.
DescriptionLore: While you possess this item, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks made against creatures that have an Intelligence score of 8 or lower. In addition, you can cast the spell 'Cause Fear' once per day without expending a spell slot. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast 'Fear' once per day. When you reach 9th level you can cast 'Mass Suggestion' once per week. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Lore: The Entropy Field hums with the chaotic energy of the Crimson Circle, possibly used in their brutal arena rituals. It shifts the very fabric of reality around it.
DescriptionLore: This item radiates an aura of chaotic energy in a 30-foot radius. At the start of each of your turns, roll a d4. On a 1, all creatures within the aura have their movement speed halved until the start of your next turn. On a 2, all spells of 3rd level or lower cast within the aura have their range doubled. On a 3, all attack rolls within the aura are made with advantage. On a 4, all saving throws within the aura are made with disadvantage. This field can be suppressed for 1 minute as an action.

Lore: Favored by Demacian sentries on long patrols, Espresso Snax are rumored to be baked with enchanted coffee beans from distant lands.
DescriptionLore: Upon consuming an Espresso Snax as an action, you regain 1d4 hit points and gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws against exhaustion for the next 4 hours. Additionally, you do not suffer the effects of exhaustion for 1 hour.

Lore: Favored by lower-ranking officers in Noxus, the Evenshroud is thought to provide protection and is associated with the Black Rose.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, as a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can grant all allies within 30 feet of you a +2 bonus to AC against that attack. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: The storm seems to call out to the stars, perhaps created by an aspect of the celestial realm.
DescriptionLore: You can cast the spell 'Reverse Gravity' once per day. When you cast it this way, the spell's duration is concentration, up to 1 minute. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can change the damage type to force damage.

Lore: Favored by Demacian scouts, allowing them to safely navigate uncharted regions and provide early warnings against potential threats.
DescriptionLore: While holding this ward, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate or avoid becoming lost. As an action, you can plant the ward in the ground; it becomes invisible and sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. Any creature that moves within 5 feet of the ward triggers an alarm, alerting you with a mental ping within a mile if you are on the same plane of existence. The ward lasts for 24 hours or until dispelled.

Lore: An ancient relic from the Frozen Watchers, radiating intense cold and magical power, with possible connections to Lissandra.
DescriptionLore: This ancient relic of the Frozen Watchers radiates palpable cold. While holding the Eye of Frost, you are immune to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a cone of frost extending 60 feet. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this effect is frozen solid. Once this ability is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn. The eye is rumored to have connections to Lissandra, and prolonged exposure may reveal secrets of forgotten ice magic at the DM's discretion.

Lore: Linked to the ancient Aspects of Targon, granting sight and protection. Possibly connected to champions like Taric or Leona.
DescriptionLore: This gem pulses with celestial energy, a fragment of the power of the Aspects of Targon. While holding the Eye of the Aspect, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws. Additionally, you can cast the Shield spell (3rd-level version) as a reaction without expending a spell slot. You can do so three times, regaining all expended uses at dawn. Champions blessed by Targon, such as Taric or Leona, may find the Eye particularly attuned to their celestial nature, granting additional benefits as determined by the DM.

Lore: Likely originating from Shurima's oasis, it might be tied to ancient guardians or benevolent spirits of the desert.
DescriptionLore: This shimmering jewel hums with the life force of Shurima's ancient oases. While holding the Eye of the Oasis, you can cast Create or Destroy Water at will. As an action, you can touch a creature and restore 4d8 hit points. Once you use this healing ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. The Eye whispers secrets of the desert, and might be connected to ancient guardians or benevolent spirits, revealing lore and quests at the DM's discretion.

Lore: Linked to the Watchers of the Freljord, ancient beings of ice and void.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this frozen orb, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect illusions or hidden creatures within 60 feet. As an action, you can peer into the icy depths of the orb, gaining truesight out to a range of 30 feet for 1 minute. Once used, this ability cannot be used again until the next dawn. The eye emanates an aura of extreme cold. Creatures within 5 feet of the orb have disadvantage on saving throws against effects that deal cold damage.

Lore: Likely crafted by a Solari order, used by scouts and sentinels to watch for signs of the Void's corruption on Runeterra.
DescriptionLore: This crystalline orb pulses with celestial energy. As an action, you can activate the orb to cast the Scrying spell (save DC 17), targeting a location or creature you have seen before. The orb can only be used once per day at dawn, after which its light dims until the next sunrise. While holding the orb, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect the presence of aberrations and creatures from other planes.

Lore: Worn by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, the Flash Zone aids in swift escapes or ambushes, resonating with the land's inherent magic.
DescriptionLore: This intricately woven sash shimmers with latent magical energy. As a bonus action, you can expend one of the sash's 3 charges to cast the Misty Step spell. The sash regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, while wearing the sash, your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to avoid being grappled or restrained.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, this armament might have belonged to a Dauntless Vanguard, or a member of the Crownguard.
DescriptionLore: This masterwork weapon, of Demacian make, grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this weapon, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to knock the target prone if it is Large or smaller.

Lore: Likely forged by the Iceborn, or by the followers of Volibear, this crest provides the wearer a burning aura.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this crest, you are wreathed in harmless flames, shedding bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. You have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of fire. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: May be linked to the Winter's Claw, perhaps used as a food source during harsh winters. Could also be associated with yetis.
DescriptionLore: These preserved rations provide sustenance and warmth in even the harshest conditions. Consuming a Frosted Snax requires an action and restores 2d4 hit points and grants advantage on Constitution saving throws against exhaustion for the next hour. A creature can only benefit from consuming one Frosted Snax every 24 hours.

Lore: Likely forged by the Ice Witch Lissandra's servants. Grants resistance to flame and creates a zone of perpetual frost.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these gauntlets, you have resistance to fire damage. As an action, you can create a 20-foot radius sphere of intense cold centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. The sphere lasts for 1 minute. Any creature that starts its turn within the sphere must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by half until the start of its next turn. Additionally, at the start of each of your turns while the sphere persists, you can choose one creature within the sphere. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 3d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: The Frozen Mallet could be associated with the Freljord, as it embodies the chilling power of the north and slowing enemies with ice.
DescriptionLore: This magical maul is perpetually cold to the touch. Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. If the creature is already affected by an effect that reduces its speed, it instead has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Lore: Favored by Demacian soldiers, particularly those facing monstrous threats or heavily armored Noxian legions, embodying the spirit of overcoming overwhelming odds.
DescriptionLore: This weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage to Large or larger creatures. When you hit a creature of Huge or Gargantuan size with this weapon, you can choose to attempt to knock it prone. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 10 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked prone.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the Aspect of Twilight, granting clarity and foresight to its user, especially among the Rakkor.
DescriptionLore: While holding this globe, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Augury spell without using a spell slot or material components. When used within a settlement primarily populated by Rakkor, you also learn one additional piece of information from the augury.

Lore: Favored by Noxian battlemages and warlords, it's believed to be tied to hemomancy and brutal, decisive victories, possibly Vladimir or the Black Rose.
DescriptionLore: This magical greatsword pulses with crimson energy. Once per long rest as an action, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can activate Goredrinker's Thirst. Until the end of your next turn, whenever you damage a creature with an attack, you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Additionally, necrotic damage dealt by you ignores resistance.

Lore: Forged with celestial energies, rumored to grant wearers brief control over gravity, potentially linked to the Aspect of Twilight.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, you can use a bonus action to briefly manipulate gravity. For 1 minute, you gain a fly speed of 30 feet. If you are still flying when the minute ends, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you reach the ground. You can use this ability once, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest. Additionally, as a reaction when you would fall, you can reduce the falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your level.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Targon, it resonates with celestial energy, potentially linked to the Aspects.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with celestial energy. While holding the orb, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks related to celestial beings or magic originating from the upper planes. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Identify spell without expending a spell slot to determine the properties of a celestial object or to discern the nature of celestial magic.

Lore: Favored by Shuriman desert travelers, the Greater Totem provides crucial knowledge of approaching dangers, both seen and unseen in the sands.
DescriptionLore: This totem grants its user heightened awareness of their surroundings. As an action, you can activate the totem, granting you advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect threats within a 60-foot radius for the next 10 minutes. While active, the totem emits a faint, pulsating light visible up to 30 feet away. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Associated with restless spirits and the spectral realm. Perhaps a tool for navigating or manipulating the undead energies of the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: This lantern burns with an ethereal flame, illuminating the spectral realm. While holding the lantern, you can see into the Ethereal Plane within a 30-foot radius. As an action, you can command the lantern to emit a beam of spectral energy. Choose one undead creature within 60 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be turned for 1 minute. A creature turned in this way must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action. Once you use this action, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Favored by Noxian warmasons and Freljordian raiders, the Hamstringer hobbles foes, leaving them vulnerable. Useful for warriors seeking an advantage in the icy north.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon, favored by Noxian warmasters and Freljordian raiders, has 7 charges. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to attempt to hamstring it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have its movement speed halved until the end of its next turn. The weapon regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn. If the weapon is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the weapon crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

Lore: A trophy taken from Kha'Zix. Symbolizes dominance over the Void and its creatures. Could be related to Rek'Sai or other Voidborn.
DescriptionLore: This grotesque trophy pulses with void energy. While holding the Head of Kha'Zix, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track Voidborn creatures. Additionally, as an action, you can present the head and force each Voidborn creature within 30 feet of you to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged on Targon, it shares health and gold. A bond of support, perhaps linked to the Solari's ideals of protection.
DescriptionLore: This shimmering amulet resonates with celestial energy. As an action, you can touch a willing creature other than yourself and forge a bond between you and that creature for 1 hour. While bonded, whenever you take damage, the bonded creature takes half of the damage, rounded down. While bonded, at the start of each of your turns, you can transfer a number of gold pieces from your possession to the bonded creature equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). This gold appears in the bonded creature's possession. You can only maintain one bond at a time. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die, or if the bonded creature is more than 100 feet away from you.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to be imbued with the essence of a vanquished fire mage. A favored weapon of warlords.
DescriptionLore: This magical hatchet, forged in Noxus, deals an extra 1d6 fire damage on a hit. Once per long rest, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, you can choose to unleash a wave of fire in a 15-foot cone originating from you. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Lore: Crude hextech components hint at early Piltover and Zaunite influence in Ionia, or perhaps an Ionian attempt to replicate it.
DescriptionLore: This curious device hums with arcane energy. As an action, you can attempt to interface with a construct or magical item. Make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a success, you gain temporary insight into the object's function, granting you advantage on one attack roll, saving throw, or ability check related to that object within the next hour. This device has no effect on artifacts or creatures.

Lore: Prototype technology, likely developed in Zaun or by a Noxian artificer, for rapid battlefield traversal and engagement. May have ties to Viktor's Glorious Evolution.
DescriptionLore: This prototype belt contains a limited-use propulsion system. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to propel yourself 30 feet in a straight line. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. Additionally, six rockets fire at the end of the movement, each targeting a point within 5 feet of the destination. Each creature within 5 feet of any of those points must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage. The belt has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Whispers link it to fallen Targonian aspects, perhaps those who dared defy the stars' rigid paths.
DescriptionLore: This faintly glowing amulet pulses with celestial energy. While wearing it, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you or an ally within 30 feet fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant them advantage on that saving throw, potentially turning the failure into a success. This property of the amulet fades at dawn if not used.

Lore: Favored by Ionian hunters and spirit walkers, allows one to track down dangerous beasts of the forests.
DescriptionLore: This elegant Ionian machete is crafted from whispersteel, its blade humming with latent energy. While holding this machete, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track beasts. Additionally, when you hit a beast with this machete, the beast takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage. If the beast is a monstrosity, it takes an extra 2d6 radiant damage instead.

Lore: Favored by Ionian spirit walkers and shadow stalkers, channels vital essence for hunting.
DescriptionLore: This intricately carved talisman throbs with spiritual power. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Wisdom saving throws against spells and effects from fey and undead creatures. As a bonus action, you can expend a Hit Die to regain a number of hit points equal to the result plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). You can't use this bonus action again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Said to be created with concentrated starlight, this substance is rumored to enhance one's connection to the celestial realm.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can apply this viscous, shimmering fluid to a weapon or piece of armor. For the next hour, the weapon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While illuminated, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage on a hit. If applied to armor, the wearer gains advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened by celestial beings. The ichor vanishes after 1 hour or after the radiant damage has been dealt a total of 10 times.

Lore: Crafted by Demacian artisans, rumored to have protective enchantments from a Radiantite shard, safeguarding the wielder.
DescriptionLore: While wielding this shield, you have resistance to radiant damage. Additionally, as a reaction when you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can activate the shield's magic. You gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum hit points, and the shield absorbs the triggering damage. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Celestial in origin, resonating with the power of constellations and cosmic balance. Grants power from beyond the stars.
DescriptionLore: This item requires attunement by a spellcaster. While attuned, you can cast the Guiding Bolt spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to channel the power of the stars, granting you advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws until the end of your next turn. During this time, your eyes gleam with starlight.

Lore: Favored by the Solari, the locket may possess lunar magic, a counter to the Lunari. Perhaps tied to Leona's power and devotion to the sun.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this locket, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can touch a willing creature and grant them temporary hit points equal to your level. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena masters and pit fighters, this brutal whip embodies strength through dominance. Used to control beasts and break the wills of foes.
DescriptionLore: This whip deals an extra 1d6 bludgeoning damage. On a hit, you can choose to attempt to knock the target prone. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier or be knocked prone. Additionally, creatures of Large size or smaller that are within 5 feet of you have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you.

Lore: Possibly named after a forgotten Freljordian hero. The item is a key component in more powerful equipment.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes and any weapon you are proficient with. Whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with an unarmed strike or a melee weapon attack while wielding this item, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

Lore: Forged by the Solari, it resonates with celestial energy, offering protection against magical assaults for those deemed worthy by the Mountain.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. In addition, the shield has 3 charges. As a reaction when you take damage from a spell, you can expend 1 charge to gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn. The shield regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Forged on Targon's slopes, it resonates with celestial energy, granting vitality and resilience to its wielder.
DescriptionLore: This gem pulses with a warm, comforting light. While holding this gem, you gain the following benefits: Your hit point maximum increases by 10. You have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion. You can use a bonus action to touch a creature and restore 1d6 hit points to it.

Lore: Forged by a Demacian artificer, the Kircheis Shard is rumored to amplify the wielder's intent, channeling inner energy into a potent strike.
DescriptionLore: This shard hums with latent energy. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can choose to expend the shard's energy. If you do, the attack deals an extra 2d6 lightning damage to the target. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Knights Vow is linked to Demacia and their ideals of protection and sacrifice. It is likely tied to a specific order of knights.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer up to 10 of that damage to yourself. You must be able to see the creature. Additionally, as an action, you can designate one willing creature you can see within 30 feet as your Vow target. While your Vow target is within 30 feet of you, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. If your Vow target is reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose to drop to 0 hit points instead. You can only have one Vow target at a time. Designating a new Vow target ends the effect on the previous target.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have been used in assassinations, allows the user to pierce through the toughest armor.
DescriptionLore: This +2 dagger ignores resistance to piercing damage. On a hit, the target's armor class is reduced by 1 until the end of their next turn. This effect is cumulative. If a creature's armor class is reduced to 10 or lower by this effect, the wielder can choose to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the wielder knows how to instantly kill the creature, and can choose to do so (instant death, no save).

Lore: Favored by assassins in the empire. Legends says they grant the wielder enhanced stealth and lethality.
DescriptionLore: This cloak is imbued with shadow magic. While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Additionally, once per day as a bonus action, you can become invisible until the end of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell. When you hit a creature that is surprised with an attack while wearing this cloak, the attack deals an additional 4d6 necrotic damage and the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of their next turn.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian monks, this staff enhances natural magic, resonating with the spirit realm and amplifying a mage's connection to the land.
DescriptionLore: This staff, crafted by Ionian monks, is a conduit to the spirit realm. While holding this staff, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to regain one expended spell slot of 5th level or lower. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, imbued with celestial power. Favored by support Ascended and the Solari for aiding allies in need.
DescriptionLore: Forged atop Mount Targon and imbued with celestial power, this item is favored by those who aid others. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant it the benefits of the Bless spell for 1 minute without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can reduce that damage by an amount equal to your level in the class that grants you the ability to cast spells. You can use each of these features a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Rumored to have been crafted from a sea monster's hide, Leviathan whispers promises of power and dominance to its wielder.
DescriptionLore: Rumored to be crafted from the hide of a colossal sea monster, Leviathan whispers promises of dominance. While wearing this armor, you gain a +3 bonus to AC. Additionally, you can breathe underwater and have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to swim. As an action, you can unleash a powerful roar. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this roar, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist and its lingering magic, tormenting those who dare wield it. May be related to the Ruination.
DescriptionLore: This twisted artifact pulses with malevolent energy from the Shadow Isles. While attuned to this item, you gain resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to unleash a wave of Black Mist. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 8d6 necrotic damage and become frightened of you for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't frightened. The item is then destroyed as the Black Mist consumes it.

Lore: Favored by warriors facing impossible odds in the Freljord, a 'Lifeline' is a blessing of the Ice Witch, granting temporary reprieve.
DescriptionLore: This amulet, blessed by the Ice Witch, is a lifeline for those facing certain doom in the harsh Freljord. If you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point, and gain temporary hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. This effect can only occur once. After the effect is triggered, the amulet crumbles to dust, its magic expended.

Lore: Potentially forged by a Demacian artisan, rumored to channel the power of starlight. Might have been wielded by a hero fighting the darkness.
DescriptionLore: This radiant blade hums with celestial power. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longsword. When you hit a creature that is vulnerable to radiant damage with this weapon, the target takes an extra 4d8 radiant damage. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Sunbeam spell (save DC 17) from the sword. While wielding the Lightbringer, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

Lore: Forged on Targon, it resonates with celestial power. Often carried by those who stand against overwhelming darkness, inspired by the sun.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this locket, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. As an action, you can unleash a burst of protective energy, granting yourself and each ally within 30 feet of you a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses after finishing a long rest.

Lore: Recovered from a drowned Oracle, it whispers secrets of unseen dangers, possibly linked to ancient sea curses or forgotten leviathans.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can consume this extract. For the next minute, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect hidden dangers, traps, and illusions. Additionally, you are immune to the frightened condition caused by curses or undead. Once consumed, the whispers fade, and the extract is gone.

Lore: Associated with Ionian monasteries, used to focus magical studies. May have been owned by a powerful spirit walker.
DescriptionLore: While holding this chapter, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, you can reroll one of the damage dice. You must use the new roll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

Lore: The echo resonates with ancient Ionian magic, amplifying the wearer's spells, connecting them to the spirit realm and first lands.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, the first spell you cast of 1st level or higher each day has its area of effect, range, and number of targets doubled. Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, you can unleash a pulse of energy. Choose up to three creatures within 30 feet of the target; each of those creatures takes force damage equal to the level of the spell.

Lore: Potentially associated with the ancient magic of Ionia and its reverence for spiritual energy. Could be tied to the Vastaya.
DescriptionLore: This pulsing orb hums with latent energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a wave of force. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw, taking 4d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orb has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the orb, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: Gamblers in Bilgewater often carry trinkets like these dice, hoping to sway Lady Luck in their favor during high-stakes games.
DescriptionLore: While you are holding these dice, you can choose to reroll one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make. You must use the new roll. Once the dice are used, roll a d6. On a roll of 1, the dice lose their magic and become ordinary dice. On a roll of 2-6, the dice can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by monstrous creature hunters in the pits of Noxus, this item was made to quickly dispatch large beasts.
DescriptionLore: When you hit a Large or larger creature with this magical weapon, you deal an extra 2d6 slashing damage. Once per long rest, you can choose to reroll any damage die from this weapon and must use the new result.

Lore: Whispers from the celestial realm suggest a connection to fallen watchers and their influence on Runeterra's magic, amplified through Targon's celestial energies.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus allows you to ignore resistance to fire damage. When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can choose one creature damaged by the spell to become poisoned until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking inner peace and harmony, aiding meditation and channeling of spiritual energy.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can regain 1d4 hit points. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, Manamune's creation involved spirit magic, resonating with the land's inherent energy and the interconnectedness of its inhabitants.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this Ionian artifact, your connection to the land enhances your spellcasting. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can maximize the damage dice of one damage type dealt by the spell.

Lore: Crafted from shipwrecked souls and sea salt, it whispers tales of vengeance from the depths. Associated with lost mariners.
DescriptionLore: This cursed blade whispers of the drowned. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Additionally, the blade deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

Lore: Potentially linked to Demacian knights, as a tool to protect allies and inspire courage through self-sacrifice.
DescriptionLore: This holy symbol, etched with the crest of a forgotten Demacian order, radiates protective energy. As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can transfer the damage to yourself. You take damage equal to the amount the other creature would have taken. If this damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you do not fall unconscious immediately. Instead, you can choose one ally within 30 feet of you. That ally gains temporary hit points equal to your maximum hit points, and advantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for 1 minute. At the end of that minute, you immediately fall unconscious, and must succeed on a DC 15 death saving throw or die. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

Lore: Associated with dark magic and power accumulation, perhaps favored by ambitious Noxian mages seeking forbidden knowledge. Could be connected to the Black Rose.
DescriptionLore: This heavy, ornate tome pulses with dark energy. While holding this book, you gain advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to learn about Necromancy spells or rituals. Additionally, whenever a creature you can see within 30 feet of you dies, you gain 1 temporary hit point. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. As an action, you can expend any number of temporary hit points granted by this book to cast the 'False Life' spell without material components, using a spell slot equal to the number of temporary hit points expended (minimum of a 1st-level spell slot).

Lore: Linked to an ancient order on Targon, dedicated to purity and protection against corruption from the Void.
DescriptionLore: This intricately carved amulet is crafted from pure silver and blessed by celestial beings. As an action, you can touch one willing creature and end one of the following conditions affecting it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. Once used, this property of the amulet cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, the wearer has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: Potentially a tool utilized by the Ascended to manage and control the flow of lesser beings and resources within their empire.
DescriptionLore: This small, crystalline shard hums with latent energy. As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you that has Challenge Rating 1 or lower. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is disintegrated, turning to fine dust. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this effect, only dust remains. Once you use this shard, it cannot be used again until the next dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack or spell and the attack roll or spell DC includes your proficiency bonus, you can add an additional 1d6 force damage.

Lore: Favored by messengers and scouts across the desert, granting swift passage between oases and ancient ruins. Often enchanted with protective spirits.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your base walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the boots' enhanced mobility. For the next 10 minutes, your walking speed is doubled, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and saving throws. Once this bonus action is used, the boots cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

Lore: Linked to the Lunari, wielding moon magic. Might be associated with champions like Diana, who draws power from the moon.
DescriptionLore: This elegant longsword is perpetually bathed in soft moonlight. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. While attuned to this weapon, you can cast the Moonbeam spell (3rd level version) once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened while holding the blade.

Lore: Associated with forbidden knowledge and necromantic practices within Noxus. Possibly tied to the Black Rose or dark mages seeking immortality.
DescriptionLore: This weighty tome radiates an aura of dark magic. While holding the Morellonomicon, you can cast the Life Transference spell once per day. Additionally, any creature you hit with a spell attack suffers one level of exhaustion after the spell resolves. Once used, the Life Transference property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Rumored to be crafted for the Ascended, perhaps at the behest of a long-lost emperor for a monstrous champion.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (any sword or dagger), very rare (requires attunement). You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 force damage. Once per turn, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can make a melee attack with this weapon as a bonus action.

Lore: Favored by mages in Ionia, enhancing their natural connection to the spirit realm and amplifying their spellcasting abilities.
DescriptionLore: Rod, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). While holding this rod, your spell attack bonus increases by +2 and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to reroll one damage die of a spell you just cast. You must use the new roll.

Lore: Whispers suggest it's linked to a fallen Shadow Isles mage, seeking to corrupt the living with arcane power.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). This grimoire pulses with necrotic energy. While holding it, you gain advantage on death saving throws. When you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you can maximize one of the damage dice instead of rolling it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, undead creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Lore: Favored by Ionian martial artists. Legends say masters can move like shadows while wearing them, blending into the spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently are made with advantage. Additionally, when you take the Dash action on your turn, your movement speed increases by 20 feet until the end of the turn.

Lore: Associated with Targon's nomadic people. Grants resilience and empowers allies nearby, embodying the mountain's supportive aspect.
DescriptionLore: While you wear this medallion, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. In addition, as an action, you can expend 1 charge to grant yourself and each creature within 30 feet of you that you can see temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). This medallion has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Crafted by Demacian mages, the Null-Magic Mantle protects against arcane threats, commonly used by frontline soldiers and mageseekers.
DescriptionLore: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. While wearing this mantle, you can use your reaction when you are hit by a spell to attempt to nullify the spell's effect. Make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect on you and is instead reflected back to the caster, targeting them as if they had cast it. If the caster is immune to the spell or effect it is simply negated.

Lore: Favored by Noxian commanders, the Obsidian Cleaver sunders armor, leaving enemies vulnerable to further assaults. Represents raw, brutal power.
DescriptionLore: This massive obsidian greataxe deals an extra 2d6 slashing damage to any creature wearing armor. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to reduce the AC of the target by 1, to a minimum of 10, until the end of your next turn. This effect stacks.

Lore: Likely crafted by the ancient Iceborn, a relic against magical assaults. Perhaps tied to a forgotten god or powerful ice witch.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this helm, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to cold damage and can withstand extreme cold environments without penalty. The helm also grants you the ability to cast the *Absorb Elements* spell once per long rest.

Lore: Favored by those scaling the mountain, rumored to be blessed by ancient aspects for protection.
DescriptionLore: This adamantine warhammer grants you advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb. Additionally, as an action, you can strike a Large or smaller construct or object. That construct or object must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability three times, regaining all expended uses at dawn.

Lore: Crafted by a reclusive Ionian bladesmith, rumored to have ties to the ancient teachings of the Kinkou Order.
DescriptionLore: This +2 Shortsword hums with a subtle energy. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can speak the sword's command word to imbue it with the Swiftness of Oponn. For the next minute, your movement speed doubles, and you gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Lore: Potentially used by Demacian mageseekers to detect hidden magic or illusions. Could be associated with Sylas's escape.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this shimmering, silver liquid, you gain the benefits of the See Invisibility spell for 1 hour. Additionally, for the same duration, you have advantage on saving throws against illusions and on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect deception. As a bonus action, you can end the effect early to cast Detect Magic, requiring no components.

Lore: Forged on Targon, rumored to ward against celestial trickery or the gaze of Aspects. Sought after by those who deal with cosmic entities.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this hood, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened by celestial beings or effects originating from the Astral Plane. Additionally, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the true nature of celestials and aberrations. Once per day, when you fail a saving throw against a celestial effect, you can choose to succeed instead.

Lore: Likely forged in the Freljord, possibly tied to the Winter's Claw or another ice-based faction. Grants resilience in harsh conditions.
DescriptionLore: While holding this orb, you are immune to the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, you can cast the 'ice storm' spell once per day, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17). The orb regains its ability to cast 'ice storm' at dawn.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena champions, Overlord's Bloodmail is a testament to brutal strength and the will to dominate, embodying the empire's values.
DescriptionLore: This suit of plate armor is forged from blackened steel and etched with stylized depictions of brutal combat. While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength checks. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target and gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, these pauldrons are rumored to have been worn by a forgotten Iceborn warrior.
DescriptionLore: These pauldrons are crafted from shimmering ice that never melts. While wearing these pauldrons, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, and the area within it is heavily obscured. Any creature that starts its turn in the blizzard or enters it for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 cold damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the Zephyr winds of Ionia, granting the wearer unnatural agility and speed. Perhaps a connection to a wind spirit.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this pendant, your base walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see. In addition, you can cast the Feather Fall spell once per long rest without using a spell slot.

Lore: Constructed in Piltover during the advent of Hextech by a master craftsman, it was outlawed for the highly wasteful desintegration of crystals on repeated use.
DescriptionLore: This stopwatch has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to become invulnerable to all damage for 1 round. At the end of your next turn, you become stunned until the end of your next turn. The stopwatch regains its charges when an hextech crystal is fed to it.

Lore: Favored by lowborn arena fighters in Noxus, the Phage's brutal design reflects the region's harsh gladiatorial traditions and thirst for blood.
DescriptionLore: This brutal weapon grants +1 to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll they make before the end of their next turn.

Lore: Favored by ascetics and wandering mystics in Targon seeking enlightenment. Often found near sites of great contemplation.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this medallion, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, once per long rest, when you fail a Wisdom saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. The medallion then loses this property until the next dawn.

Lore: Whispers link it to a forgotten Ionian wind spirit, granting swiftness to those deemed worthy. Some believe it responds to inner peace.
DescriptionLore: This item grants the wearer a +1 bonus to their initiative rolls and increases their movement speed by 10 feet. As a bonus action, the wearer can also grant themselves advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks until the end of their turn. Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the start of the wearer's next turn.

Lore: Likely plundered from a rival pirate crew or a foolish merchant vessel, hinting at the unscrupulous nature of Bilgewater's inhabitants.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4 + 2 hit points. This potion's color swirls with shades of murky green and smells faintly of brine and regret.

Lore: Likely stolen from a rival pirate crew or found in a hidden cove, used to scout out enemies.
DescriptionLore: This small, magically imbued totem can be planted as an action. For the next 8 hours, the ward is invisible and emits a pulse out to a 60-foot radius. Any creature entering this radius is clearly visible, and you are alerted to their presence (but not their location) if you are within 1 mile of the ward. A ward has an AC of 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. It can be destroyed.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, the dirk is often used to secure bounties. The dirk is rumored to be crafted from metal sourced from a fallen darkin.
DescriptionLore: This dagger is a magic weapon. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this dagger that is below half of its maximum hit points, you can choose to deal an additional 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you gain advantage on all Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track that creature for the next 24 hours.

Lore: Poro-Snax are beloved by poros, creatures native to the Freljord, often found around hearths and ancient ruins. Feeding them strengthens their bond.
DescriptionLore: A delicious treat adored by poros. As an action, you can feed a Poro-Snax to a friendly Poro. The poro becomes especially loyal and helpful, granting you advantage on one Wisdom (Animal Handling) check you make to interact with it within the next hour. Alternatively, if no poros are present, consuming a Poro-Snax yourself grants you advantage on the next Wisdom (Survival) check you make to navigate through snowy or icy terrain within the next hour.

Lore: Whispers say the Pox Arcana was penned by a hemomancer seeking to weaponize disease for the empire.
DescriptionLore: This ancient tome is rumored to contain vile hemomantic rituals capable of weaponizing disease. While holding the Pox Arcana, you can cast the Contagion spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against contracting diseases, and whenever you successfully inflict a creature with the poisoned condition, the duration of the condition is doubled.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial power. Might have connection with the Solari or Lunari.
DescriptionLore: Forged on the summit of Mount Targon, this weapon pulses with celestial energy. While attuned to Primordial Dawn, you can use a bonus action to cause it to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. As an action, you can call upon the weapon's power to cast the Sunbeam spell (save DC 17) once per day. The weapon deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage to any creature that is vulnerable to sunlight.

Lore: Whispers say Priscilla, a forgotten noble, blessed it for her champions. Now it is a symbol of cruel ambition, sought by those craving power.
DescriptionLore: This dark amulet is said to have been blessed by a forgotten Noxian noble. While wearing Priscilla's Blessing, you gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Additionally, once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's challenge rating. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. If the creature was a humanoid, you also learn one piece of information about its deepest desires or fears.

Lore: The blade is rumored to have been forged in the Freljord, possibly by a forgotten tribe seeking to claim new lands and resources.
DescriptionLore: This finely crafted blade hums with a faint, icy energy. Once per day, when you hit a creature with this sword, you can choose to have the attack deal an extra 2d6 cold damage and reduce the creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. The blade is rumored to lead the wielder to caches of valuable ore and precious gems, revealing hidden veins and deposits within a 1-mile radius while attuned.

Lore: Associated with Viktor, and the founding of the Glorious Evolution. Could be tied to the Spirit of Innovation, if Ionia ever focused on tech.
DescriptionLore: This intricate device pulses with arcane energy and strange potential. As an action, you can expend a hit die to infuse the Hex Core with your life force, granting you one of the following benefits for 1 minute: Advantage on Intelligence checks and saving throws; Resistance to lightning damage; or the ability to cast the *shocking grasp* cantrip, even if you don't know it. You can only have one benefit active at a time. Further experimentation may unlock additional enhancements.

Lore: Whispers claim these threads are spun from the souls of the damned, granting control over the living.
DescriptionLore: This tangled skein of ghostly threads grants the user control over the bodies of others. As an action, you can target one humanoid within 30 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to mentally command the target to move up to its speed and perform one simple action that it would normally be capable of. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effects of the Puppeteer for 24 hours.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking clarity and protection from outside influences. It is sometimes seen amongst travelling merchants in Bilgewater.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this sash, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or possessed. Additionally, as a reaction when you fail a saving throw against an effect that would charm, frighten, or possess you, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Favored by mages in Ionia, Rabadon's Deathcrown is a symbol of magical prowess and deep understanding of arcane energies, possibly connected to the spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this crown, your spell attack bonus and spell save DC each increase by 2. In addition, the damage dice of your spells are maximized (e.g., a d6 becomes a 6). Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 5th level or lower, you can cast it as if using a spell slot one level higher.

Lore: Favored by Ionian spirit walkers, it aids traversing untamed lands, ensuring harmony with nature's path.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, you ignore difficult terrain. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the *pass without trace* spell. The boots have 3 charges and regain 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing these boots and attuned to nature, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate or track.

Lore: Favored by scouts patrolling Demacia's borders, allowing for faster movement between outposts.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this cloak, your speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently through natural environments.

Lore: Rectrix, a quill from a celestial being, perhaps related to the Aspect of Justice or Judgment.
DescriptionLore: This quill, plucked from a celestial being, radiates a faint aura of justice. While holding the Rectrix, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can use the quill to cast the Zone of Truth spell (DC 15).

Lore: Associated with the celestial, embodying sacrifice and healing, perhaps linked to the Aspect of the Host.
DescriptionLore: This sacred amulet embodies sacrifice and healing. As an action, you can touch a creature and expend a charge to heal it for 4d6 hit points. Additionally, if a creature within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can expend a charge as a reaction to cause it to instead drop to 1 hit point. The amulet has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Commonly used by travelers and adventurers, rumored to be brewed with rare Ionian herbs known for their restorative properties.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 4d4 hit points. In addition, for the next minute, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns (10 hit points total). This potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

Lore: Often found near ancient wells, rumored to be blessed by a long forgotten spirit, granting resilience to those who carry them.
DescriptionLore: This bead is frigid to the touch, and faintly glows with frost. As an action, you can crush the bead, releasing its energy. You regain 2d8 hit points, and are cured of one disease or poison affecting you.

Lore: Favored by frontline soldiers of Demacia, it is often used by those who fight alongside weaker allies, or when defending fortifications.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, when a creature within 5 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer half of the damage (rounded up) to yourself. You must be able to see the creature. Additionally, while wielding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would knock you prone.

Lore: Associated with Targon's ascended, granting enhanced mana regeneration and ability power.
DescriptionLore: While holding this remnant, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, you regain 1 sorcery point or 1 expended spell slot of 3rd level or lower upon finishing a short or long rest. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

Lore: Linked to the Watchers, ancient beings of the Freljordian ice, offering glimpses into their chilling power.
DescriptionLore: While holding this remnant, you have resistance to cold damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened. As an action, you can attempt to freeze a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become restrained for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the restrained creature can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Riftmaker is likely tied to the Black Rose, an organization known for dark magic and manipulating rifts for their own purposes.
DescriptionLore: This dark artifact grants you a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls with spells. Whenever you deal damage with a spell, you regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Additionally, you ignore resistance to necrotic damage. This item is cursed. Becoming attuned to this item extends the attunement duration indefinitely. While attuned, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. If you die from exhaustion, your body is overtaken by the Void.

Lore: Forged in the bitter cold, said to be able to freeze the very ground on which battles are fought. Possibly linked to the Ice Witch.
DescriptionLore: This gauntlet, perpetually cold to the touch, is forged from ice that never melts. While wearing the gauntlet, you can use an action to freeze a 15-foot cone of ground in front of you. This area becomes difficult terrain. Additionally, any creature that starts its turn or enters the area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its movement speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. The ice melts after 1 minute. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Targon, infused with celestial energies, it whispers forgotten truths to those who dare listen. Grants resilience in prolonged battles.
DescriptionLore: This rod, pulsing with a faint celestial light, whispers secrets of ages past to its wielder. The rod has 10 charges and regains 1d6+4 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the rod, you can expend charges to gain the following benefits: (1 charge) You gain advantage on one Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw.
