(3 charges) You regain 2d8 hit points. (5 charges) You cast the 'Greater Restoration' spell. If you listen to the whispers of the rod for at least 1 hour each day, you gain one level of exhaustion at the end of the hour, but also gain resistance to psychic damage until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energy. It might be linked to the Aspect of Twilight, enhancing map awareness.
DescriptionLore: This crimson stone, warm to the touch, grants unparalleled awareness of your surroundings. As an action, you can touch a point within 60 feet of you. For the next hour, you know the location of all creatures within a 30-foot radius of that point. This ability pierces magical darkness and nonmagical barriers, but is blocked by one foot of stone, one inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn. While attuned to the Ruby Sightstone, you are immune to the blinded condition.

Lore: Likely forged by ancient Iceborn, the Runecarver's etchings resonate with forgotten glacial magic and Freljordian spirits.
DescriptionLore: This weapon pulses with ancient glacial magic. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d6 cold damage to the target and force it to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is also restrained for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Lore: Likely a relic of the ancient Iceborn, perhaps used in rituals to consume the power of primal runes.
DescriptionLore: This relic radiates a faint aura of consumed power. When you use this item to absorb a magic rune or magical effect (DM's discretion), you gain temporary hit points equal to five times the level of the spell or effect consumed. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Additionally, for the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 force damage.

Lore: Favored by Demacian sentinels, this bulwark's runes deflect magic. Some whisper it was crafted by mageseekers, a twisted irony.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, once per day, when you are targeted by a spell, you can use your reaction to attempt to absorb the spell's energy. Make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect on you, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the spell's level x 5.

Lore: Echoes resonate with Ionian spirit magic, amplifying spellcasting. Potentially tied to ancient monasteries or spirit realms.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus pulses with Ionian spirit magic. While holding this focus, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose to deal an additional 2d6 force damage to one target within 30 feet of the original target. This additional damage is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity.

Lore: Associated with monks of Ionia seeking enlightenment and inner peace, enhancing their connection to the spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: This ring hums with tranquil energy. While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a hit die to regain a number of hit points equal to the die roll + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) per long rest.

Lore: Forged in the desert's heart, it whispers of ancient Ascended, their power now sand. A relic of forgotten empires.
DescriptionLore: This ancient claw, imbued with the power of fallen Ascended, grants potent abilities. The claw is a +2 magical melee weapon. When you hit a creature with it, you can force the target to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the target takes 2d6 necrotic damage. This effect can only be used once per turn.

Lore: Implies a dark pact or ritual sacrifice within Noxus, possibly connected to the Crimson Circle or similar hemomancy cult.
DescriptionLore: This dark gift, pulsing with crimson energy, is bestowed upon those who enter into a pact with entities of pure hemomancy. While attuned to this gift, whenever you deal damage with a spell or weapon attack, you can choose to regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt (rounded up). This effect can only be used once per turn. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion as the gift demands its due.

Lore: A relic from the Shadow Isles, possibly tied to ancient rituals enhancing predator instincts. It is tied to the hunger of the void.
DescriptionLore: This grotesque amulet, reeking of voidal energies, grants the wearer an insatiable hunger for power. While attuned to the Sated Devourer, you gain the following benefits: Your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. After a long rest you must consume the life force of a beast or humanoid by succeeding on a DC 16 grapple check, or suffer two levels of exhaustion.

Lore: Used by Demacian scouts to survey enemy positions. It could reveal hidden Noxian camps or Freljordian raiding parties before they strike.
DescriptionLore: This Demacian-made crystal orb allows the user to cast the Scrying spell without expending a spell slot. Once attuned, you may cast the Scrying spell once per day. Additionally, while holding the orb, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect hidden creatures or objects within 30 feet.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have ties to the Black Rose, offering protection to mages delving into forbidden magic.
DescriptionLore: This dark iron armguard, etched with arcane symbols, grants its wearer a +2 bonus to AC. While wearing the armguard, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a spell attack, you can absorb some of the spell's energy, gaining temporary hit points equal to the spell's level.

Lore: Associated with undeath and pain, possibly linked to the Black Mist or souls trapped within the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: This shard of pure darkness radiates a chilling aura. While holding it, you are resistant to necrotic damage and your hit point maximum cannot be reduced. Once per day, as an action, you can unleash the shard's power, forcing each creature within 30 feet to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The shard whispers to you in your dreams, urging you to embrace despair.

Lore: Forged in the Freljord, perhaps by a forgotten Ice Witch or a master blacksmith of the Winter's Claw. Grants lethality and armor penetration.
DescriptionLore: This Freljordian weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, the attack deals an extra 2d6 cold damage and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Potentially tied to Lissandra or other Iceborn, grants vision and slows enemies. Once held immense power now a fragment.
DescriptionLore: This shard pulses with ancient ice magic. As an action, you can touch the shard to a point within 60 feet. A spectral eye appears there, granting you and your allies vision of that area for 1 minute. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Slow spell (save DC 15) from the shard. While holding the shard, you have resistance to cold damage.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, Sheen's magic resonates with righteousness, empowering the wielder's next strike with amplified force.
DescriptionLore: This polished stone hums with righteous energy. Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot as a bonus action. The attack deals an extra 2d8 radiant damage per level of the spell slot expended. If you have no spell slots, you can use this effect once per long rest to deal 2d8 radiant damage.

Lore: Likely crafted by Demacian artificers, perhaps enchanted by mages, for scouting and defense against unseen threats in the wilderness.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you can use a bonus action to activate it, granting yourself and each ally within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your level + your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once used, the shield can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Associated with the Aspects of Targon, channeling celestial energies and offering protection to allies through ethereal shields and swiftness.
DescriptionLore: This holy symbol allows you to cast the Shield spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can invoke the Reverie, granting all allies within 30 feet of you advantage on Dexterity saving throws and increasing their movement speed by 15 feet for 1 minute. Once you use this action, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be able to weaken even a Watcher's grip. Grants tenacity and cleanse effects.
DescriptionLore: While holding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can unleash the Silvermere Dawn, ending one condition (blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, or poisoned) affecting you. Additionally, for the next minute, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would impose any of those conditions on you. Once used, this ability can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists and pit fighters, enhancing their combat prowess in skirmishes. Some say it whispers secrets of forgotten techniques.
DescriptionLore: This elegant sabre hums with latent energy. While wielding this weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to initiative rolls. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this sabre, you can choose to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Lore: Likely acquired through less-than-reputable means in Bilgewater, perhaps involving deals with the Buhru or illicit ventures in the Serpent Isles.
DescriptionLore: This seemingly ordinary sack is charmed to produce more gold. Once per day, when you reach into the sack, it contains 1d20 + 50 gold pieces. However, there is a 10% chance that instead of gold, the sack contains a non-magical poisonous snake (use the stats for a Poisonous Snake from the Monster Manual) that immediately attacks.

Lore: Said to be forged in the soulfires of the Black Rose, the Soul Sickle corrupts the wielder with dark intent and insatiable hunger.
DescriptionLore: This magical sickle, rumored to be forged in the soulfires of the Black Rose, whispers dark promises to its wielder. While holding the Soul Sickle, you have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this sickle, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

Lore: A relic of the Shadow Isles, possibly connected to lost rituals of life and death, now corrupted by undeath.
DescriptionLore: A chilling blade from the Shadow Isles. This magic cutlass deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul. The soul remains trapped within the cutlass until you use an action to release it, or until the cutlass is destroyed. While a soul is trapped, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. You can only have one soul trapped at a time.

Lore: Associated with spirits and protection against malevolent magic, perhaps used by sentinels or those venturing into the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionLore: This ethereal cowl offers protection against the supernatural. While wearing the cowl, you have resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being possessed. Additionally, as an action, you can invoke the cowl to cast the Sanctuary spell (save DC 15) on yourself. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by mageseekers, rumored to be forged from petricite, a stone that nullifies magic, originating from Demacia.
DescriptionLore: This rare shield is crafted from petricite, a stone that disrupts magic. While wielding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you casts a spell, you can attempt to disrupt the spell. Make a DC 15 ability check using your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

Lore: Forged in the ancient glaciers, this item resonates with the strength and endurance of the Freljord's primal spirits and legendary golems.
DescriptionLore: This very rare amulet pulses with the ancient magic of the Freljord. While wearing this amulet, your hit point maximum increases by 20. Additionally, you gain resistance to cold damage and have advantage on saving throws against being petrified. As an action, you can tap into the spirit of the golem, granting yourself temporary hit points equal to your level. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Associated with the Shadow Isles, potentially used by spectral beings or wraiths to enhance their magical abilities and sustain themselves.
DescriptionLore: This legendary artifact whispers with the chilling energy of the Shadow Isles. While holding this spectral orb, you gain the following benefits: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level. You have resistance to necrotic damage. As a bonus action, you can become ethereal until the end of your next turn. While ethereal, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 (1d10) force damage if you end your turn inside an object. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Forged with celestial magic, it resonates with champions touched by the stars, like Zoe or Aurelion Sol, amplifying their innate cosmic power.
DescriptionLore: This instrument, imbued with the raw power of the cosmos, resonates with those touched by celestial forces. If you are a Celestial Warlock, Sorcerer with the Aberrant Mind or Divine Soul origin, or a Cleric of the Knowledge or Twilight Domain, you can use the Starcaster as a spellcasting focus. While wielding it, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 3. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals radiant damage, you can reroll any 1s on the damage dice, and must use the new result.

Lore: Celestial power enhances champions, akin to the Aspect of Might's influence on chosen warriors.
DescriptionLore: This grants a permanent +2 to one ability score of your choice, up to a maximum of 20. In addition, you gain proficiency in one skill associated with that ability (if you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead).

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking inner peace, it channels spiritual energy. Could be associated with the teachings of Karma.
DescriptionLore: While holding this quarterstaff, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend 1 ki point to gain advantage on the next saving throw you make before the end of your next turn. If you have no ki points, you can still gain advantage on the saving throw, but you suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Favored by Demacian soldiers. Bears the crest of a forgotten order of knights. Grants courage and resilience in battle.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these shoulderguards, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. In addition, when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists, its quickening hum resonates with the spirit realm. Often used in ceremonies and duels to quicken the participants.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely balanced shortsword hums faintly when held. You gain a +1 bonus to initiative rolls. As a bonus action, you can speak the sword's command word to imbue it with spirit energy for 1 minute. While imbued, your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and saving throws.

Lore: Forged by a forgotten Ionian master, rumored to channel storm spirits. Its raw power is sought by those who desire unmatched striking speed.
DescriptionLore: This magical longsword crackles with electrical energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Forged with celestial fire, it is reminiscent of artifacts wielded by the Solari, warding off darkness.
DescriptionLore: This radiant shield is forged from celestial metal. While holding this shield, you have resistance to fire damage and gain a +2 bonus to your AC. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the Aegis's aura. While the aura is active, any creature within 10 feet of you takes 1d6 radiant damage at the start of each of its turns. The aura lasts for 1 minute, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Likely crafted by Ionian spirit walkers, enhances magical bonds and connection. Perhaps used during meditation or communion with spirits.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this amulet, once per long rest, when a creature within 30 feet that you can see takes damage, you can choose to take half of that damage instead, rounded down. Additionally, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the emotional state of creatures you have a bond with.

Lore: Likely created by a Noxian artificer, its crude construction suggests it's meant for frontline soldiers.
DescriptionLore: This crude but effective device functions as a wondrous item. As an action, you can activate T.U.R.B.O., granting you the following benefits for 1 minute: Your movement speed doubles. You gain advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. At the end of each of your turns while T.U.R.B.O. is active, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. Once used, T.U.R.B.O. cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged on Targon, this brace resonates with celestial power, assisting those who protect the vulnerable. Often used by the Rakkor.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this brace, you can use a bonus action to grant one creature within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see is hit by an attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use each of these features a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Associated with celestial magic, often carried by mages seeking to amplify their connection to the heavens and increase their mana reserves.
DescriptionLore: While holding this crystalline tear, you can use a bonus action to recover 1d4 expended spell slots. The combined level of spell slots recovered cannot exceed 2. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by monks and traveling merchants, allowing for swift travel to remote temples or bustling marketplaces across Ionia.
DescriptionLore: This small, intricately carved stone allows you to cast the Teleport spell once. When you cast the spell in this way, you ignore the 'familiarity' requirement; you can teleport to any location you have seen before, regardless of how well you know it. Once used, the stone turns to dust.

Lore: Potentially tied to void corruption experiments performed during the height of the Ascended empire. Could be tied to Bel'Veth.
DescriptionLore: This pulsating, obsidian shard grants the user resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, as an action, you can touch a creature and force them to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's maximum hit points are reduced by 1d6 for 1 hour. You can't use this ability again until the next dawn.

Lore: Associated with the Black Rose, it likely enhances the wearer's cunning and resilience, maybe connected to LeBlanc or Swain.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against being charmed or frightened. In addition, once per day, you can cast the Suggestion spell (save DC 15). This ring is associated with the Black Rose and enhances the wearer's cunning and resilience.

Lore: Favored by melee combatants and warriors of the Iron Legion, each spike is rumored to be quenched in the blood of the fallen.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armor, whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, you have resistance to piercing damage. This armor is favored by melee combatants and warriors of the Iron Legion, with each spike rumored to be quenched in the blood of the fallen.

Lore: A discarded coin from a bygone Shuriman dynasty, hinting at the empire's forgotten wealth and the transience of power. Likely a trinket of a fallen emperor.
DescriptionLore: This timeworn coin, a relic from a fallen Shuriman dynasty, whispers of forgotten wealth. While holding the coin, you can cast the *Detect Magic* spell once per long rest. Additionally, once per week, you can meditate with the coin for 1 hour to gain advantage on a single History check related to Shurima.

Lore: Likely owned by a powerful Ice Witch, its magic allows the bearer to glimpse echoes of the past and slow their foes.
DescriptionLore: This icy artifact, once held by a powerful Ice Witch of the Freljord, allows you to glimpse echoes of the past and hinder your enemies. As an action, you can touch an object or creature to perceive a brief vision of its recent past. Additionally, once per day, you can cast *Ray of Frost* as a 3rd-level spell (spell save DC 15).

Lore: Said to be favored by nomadic ascetics who dwell on the slopes of Mount Targon, seeking enlightenment and offering aid to weary travelers.
DescriptionLore: Favored by the nomadic ascetics of Mount Targon, this medallion grants resilience and guidance. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate mountainous terrain. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant it temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Likely once belonging to a Frost Priestess, the item hums with dormant power, awaiting a wielder worthy of channeling the glacial energies within.
DescriptionLore: While holding this dagger, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the save DC of your spells. Once per day, when you hit a creature with a spell attack using this dagger, you can choose to steal a spell slot from the target. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or lose one random spell slot of the highest level they have available. You regain a spell slot of the same level. This dagger also grants resistance to cold damage.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, this brace resonates with celestial power, offering protection to its wielder and empowering their allies.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this brace, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. As an action, you can unleash a celestial wave. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be knocked prone and take 3d8 radiant damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, allies within 10 feet of you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Lore: Brewed with mystical glacial water, favored by Iceborn. Provides sustenance and inner resolve for surviving in harsh environments.
DescriptionLore: When you consume this biscuit, you regain all hit points. For the next 24 hours, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and you are immune to the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you gain resistance to cold damage for the duration.

Lore: Associated with nomadic tribes charting the shifting sands, or perhaps ancient Ascended beings who needed to survey their vast empire. Used to observe enemies.
DescriptionLore: This ornate knife grants advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures. Additionally, as an action, you can plunge the knife into the ground and visualize the movements of creatures within 1 mile for the next minute. The DM determines what information is revealed, but it typically includes the number, type, and general direction of travel of creatures.

Lore: Often carried by Noxian legionnaires on long marches, a smaller, less potent version of the elixirs used by the Trifarix.
DescriptionLore: For 1 hour after drinking this potion, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, your carrying capacity is doubled for the duration.

Lore: Commonly carried by Noxian soldiers before battle, this elixir is rumored to be brewed with secret ingredients to inspire aggression.
DescriptionLore: For 1 minute after drinking this potion, you gain advantage on attack rolls and Strength checks and saving throws. In addition, at the start of each of your turns, you gain 5 temporary hit points.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking versatile power, rumored to be inspired by ancient fighting styles. Often sought after by pit fighters in Noxus.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon grants +2 to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn gains advantage. Additionally, once per turn, when you cast a spell, the next weapon attack you make before the end of your turn deals an extra 1d8 force damage.

Lore: Likely crafted by Noxian alchemists or engineers, designed for quick assaults and area denial. Could be associated with Singed's experiments.
DescriptionLore: This wondrous item requires attunement. As an action, you can activate the Chemtank, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute: Your movement speed is doubled. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks and Strength saving throws. At the end of each of your turns while the Chemtank is active, each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of your next turn. Once used, the Chemtank cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

Lore: Likely related to lost souls or spectral entities of the Shadow Isles, perhaps used in rituals to bind or control spirits.
DescriptionLore: This unsettling mask requires attunement. While wearing this mask, you can cast the 'detect thoughts' spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can target one creature you can see within 30 feet and force it to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened by you for 1 minute. The frightened creature must use its movement on each of its turns to move as far away from you as possible. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: A relic from the Shadow Isles, rumored to be tied to spirits seeking to sow confusion and dread among the living.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to these spectral pauldrons, you can cast the *invisibility* spell once per day. When you do, two translucent, ghostly duplicates of yourself appear alongside you for the duration of the spell. These duplicates mimic your movements but provide no tactical advantage beyond visual distraction.

Lore: Favored by those who navigate treacherous currents, Typhoon Claws are rumored to be imbued with the spirit of a raging storm.
DescriptionLore: These handwraps grant a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes. Additionally, once per short rest, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can attempt to push the target up to 15 feet away from you in a straight line. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed and knocked prone. Finally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being swept away or knocked prone by powerful gusts of wind or water.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist and the anguished spirits of the Shadow Isles, it seems to amplify their despair.
DescriptionLore: This dark amulet whispers promises of power fueled by sorrow. While wearing it, you gain resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. Furthermore, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be overwhelmed with despair, suffering disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn.

Lore: Likely crafted by a hemomancer within Noxus. Perhaps associated with Vladmir or one of his apprentices.
DescriptionLore: This scepter pulses with dark energy. While holding it, you gain the following benefits: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. Whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you regain hit points equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell. This healing cannot exceed the amount of damage dealt by the spell. In addition, once per long rest, as an action, you can expend a number of hit dice up to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take necrotic damage equal to the total rolled on the hit dice and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Lore: Likely used by Demacian armies for morale and coordination. Could be associated with the Dauntless Vanguard.
DescriptionLore: This banner radiates courage. While the banner is within 30 feet of you and unfurled, you and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. You can reroll any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, but you must use the new roll. Each friendly creature can only use this reroll once per long rest. As a bonus action, you can plant the banner into the ground. While planted, the banner emanates an aura that grants advantage on death saving throws to friendly creatures within 60 feet. The banner remains planted until you use a bonus action to uproot it. The banner can be destroyed (AC 10, 10 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage).

Lore: Vespertide's enchantments hint at ties to dark magic, perhaps related to the Black Rose or forgotten Noxian rituals.
DescriptionLore: This dagger hums with shadowy power. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this dagger, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The dagger has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dusk. Additionally, you can cast the *darkness* spell once per long rest without using a spell slot.

Lore: Favored by young mages in Ionia, Doran's Ring is often seen as a stepping stone to more powerful arcane artifacts.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. Additionally, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns if you have at least 1 hit point.

Lore: Horns are commonly used among the Freljord tribes to signal a coming raid. It could be used by the Winter's Claw or the Avarosan.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can blow this horn. Each creature within 30 feet of you that is hostile must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, the horn cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Bred in the harsh climates of the Freljord, these pups are favored by those seeking to ignite a fire in their hearts.
DescriptionLore: You can use an action to summon a Scorchclaw Pup familiar. It uses the statistics of a Weasel, but it also deals 1 fire damage with its bite attack. As a bonus action, you can command the pup to breathe a cone of fire that deals 1d4 fire damage in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take the damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. If the pup dies, it reappears after 1d4 days.

Lore: Favored by Demacian scouts, these wards reveal hidden threats, embodying the kingdom's vigilance against mages and Noxian spies.
DescriptionLore: When you use an action to plant this magical ward, it becomes invisible. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. A creature can use an action to attempt a DC 12 Intelligence (Investigation) check to spot the ward. If the check succeeds, the ward becomes visible. While active, the ward emits a magical aura in a 60-foot radius. This aura reveals invisible creatures and objects, and it suppresses magical illusions, revealing their true form. The ward lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed.

Lore: Used by Ionian monks to quickly recover from wounds sustained during meditation or combat. Could be related to the Spirit Blossom festival.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can drink this potion or administer it to another creature within reach. The drinker regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. The potion's crimson liquid glimmers with swirling golden motes.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks for centuries to protect sacred groves from outsiders.
DescriptionLore: As an action, you can plant this magical ward. The ward is invisible and lasts for 8 hours. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. A creature can use an action to attempt a DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the ward. If the check succeeds, the ward becomes visible. While active, the ward alerts you if any creature comes within 30 feet of it. You are mentally alerted to the presence of a creature; you do not know what kind of creature it is.

Lore: Associated with the Void and Watchers through the summoning of Rift Herald. Void corruption spreads from the host to the surrounding area.
DescriptionLore: This grotesque eye pulses with dark energy. As an action, you can crush the eye, summoning a Rift Herald to a point you can see within 60 feet. The Rift Herald acts as an ally and obeys your commands. It uses the statistics of a Young Purple Worm, with the following changes: it is size Large, its type is aberration, and it has 60 hit points. The Rift Herald disappears after 1 minute, or when reduced to 0 hit points. Once the eye is crushed, the area within 30 feet of where it was crushed becomes filled with a tangible aura of void corruption for 1 hour. Any creature that starts its turn within this area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d6 psychic damage and gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Favored by the Fortune's loyal crew, providing extra gold after a kill. Could be associated with gangs or freebooters of Bilgewater.
DescriptionLore: This small pouch seems to magically refill itself. After you participate in defeating a creature with a challenge rating of 1 or higher, you gain a number of gold pieces equal to the creature's challenge rating (minimum of 1 gp). If the creature has no listed challenge rating, the DM determines an appropriate amount. This pouch can hold up to 100 gold pieces, and any excess gold is lost.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, these boots enhance mental clarity and swiftness, embodying Ionian ideals of balance and enlightenment. Connected to the spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can reduce the casting time to 1 action if the casting time is normally longer. Alternatively, if the spell has a casting time of 1 action, you may cast it as a bonus action.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, perhaps linked to a celestial being granting swiftness and adaptability.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. As a bonus action, you can adapt the soles to grant you one of the following benefits for 1 minute: advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks, the ability to walk on difficult terrain as if it were normal terrain, or the ability to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the B. F. Sword is rumored to be forged in blood magic, amplifying the wielder's strength.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to have the attack deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Commonly used by Ionian villagers and trained acolytes alike; a simple tool with many uses. Often enchanted by novice practitioners.
DescriptionLore: This simple dagger is a +1 weapon. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can imbue the dagger with elemental energy, choosing acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. The next attack you make with the dagger before the end of your turn deals an extra 1d6 damage of the chosen type.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, it's rumored to be imbued with the essence of ancient fire mages, fueling their destructive power.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you are immune to fire damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of heat in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the following dawn.

Lore: Associated with celestial bodies and the magic of Targon. Grants resilience and mana, potentially linked to the Aspects.
DescriptionLore: While holding this catalyst, you gain the following benefits: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Whenever you regain hit points from a spell or magical effect, you also regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Whenever you expend a spell slot, you regain 2d4 hit points.

Lore: Favored by Noxian generals for its brutal efficiency, the blade inflicts grievous wounds, hindering regeneration and healing on the battlefield.
DescriptionLore: This wicked blade, when it hits a creature, prevents the target from regaining hit points until the start of your next turn. Additionally, the first time the target attempts to regain hit points before the start of your next turn, they must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Often reinforced with True Ice, Giant's Belts are favored by hardy Freljordian warriors and chieftains for their resilience.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this belt, your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws against being moved or knocked prone. The belt has 3 charges. As a reaction when you would be subjected to forced movement you can expend a charge to negate the movement.

Lore: Favored by low-ranking Noxian officers to protect from magical attacks. Some speculate it's made from captive mages' essence.
DescriptionLore: While holding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against spells. If you take damage from a spell, you can use your reaction to absorb the magical energy. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to the spell's level + your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Associated with nomadic tribes navigating the harsh Freljordian landscape, seeking ancient ruins and forgotten paths.
DescriptionLore: While holding this compass, you always know which direction is north. Additionally, once per day, you can use an action to ask the compass to guide you to the nearest ruin or area of historical significance within 10 miles. The compass hums softly and the needle spins before settling on the direction of the chosen location. The guidance lasts for 1 hour, after which you must wait until the next dawn to use this ability again.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena fighters, the Brutalizer enhances aggression and lethality, embodying the empire's values.
DescriptionLore: This menacing weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the wielder can choose to forgo dealing damage and instead inflict a stack of 'Brutalized' on the target (max 3 stacks). While Brutalized, the target has disadvantage on Dexterity and Wisdom saving throws. At the start of each of the target's turns, they can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, removing one stack on a success. If the target reaches 3 stacks, they are also stunned until the end of their next turn.

Lore: Likely crafted in Demacia, given its resistance to magic and the nation's anti-magic stance. May be related to Galio or the petricite forests.
DescriptionLore: This elegant shield is crafted from petricite, granting the wielder advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Once per day, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet takes spell damage, you can grant resistance to that damage type to the target until the end of their next turn. This property of the shield can only be used to grant resistance to one damage type per day, chosen when the ability is activated.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking swiftness, its origins trace back to ancient movement techniques studied in monasteries.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, your speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can Dash.

Lore: The Axiom Arc is believed to be crafted by a prodigious member of the Yun Tal, possibly even the daughter of Ixtal's leader, who sought to encapsulate the essence of the Axiomata into a single, formidable artifact. Its creation marked a pivotal moment in Ixtal's history, symbolizing the unification of elemental principles into a harmonious whole.​
DescriptionLore: Forged through the intricate weaving of elemental forces, the Axiom Arc is a testament to Ixtal's mastery over the Axiomata. This artifact pulses with latent energy, awaiting a wielder attuned to the elemental threads of the world. While attuned to the Axiom Arc, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 1. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell, you can choose to regain an expended 3rd-level or lower spell slot. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can channel the Axiom Arc's power to cast one of the following spells without expending a spell slot: elemental weapon, protection from energy, or wall of fire. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. The Axiom Arc is believed to be crafted by a prodigious member of the Yun Tal, possibly even the daughter of Ixtal's leader, who sought to encapsulate the essence of the Axiomata into a single formidable artifact. Its creation marked a pivotal moment in Ixtal's history, symbolizing the unification of elemental principles into a harmonious whole.

Lore: Forged in the Shadow Isles, it corrupts the wielder, draining life and empowering attacks. Linked to the Ruination and potentially Viego.
DescriptionLore: This corrupted longsword whispers of power and decay. On a hit, the blade deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. As a bonus action, you can attempt to steal the life force of a creature you have hit with this blade. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 necrotic damage and become charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. While attuned to this blade, your alignment tends towards Chaotic Evil.

Lore: Crafted with materials echoing Ascended might, its creation may be tied to a powerful mage seeking to restore Shurima's glory.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: Likely tied to the Black Mist and the life-draining magic of the Shadow Isles. Could be related to the Ruination.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: Crafted by celestial artisans, it is said to be imbued with the power to shape dreams and destinies, influenced by Zoe.
DescriptionLore: N/A

Lore: Said to be tied to ancient Ionian magic, possibly related to spirit energy manipulation techniques or a lost sword-fighting style.
DescriptionLore: This blade pulses with Ionian spirit energy. While attuned to this weapon, when you score a critical hit with it, you regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dice of the weapon. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do, the blade emits a burst of energy, dealing 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures within 15 feet of you. You then gain temporary hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

Lore: Forged in the coldest reaches of the Freljord, rumored to have been touched by the spirit of a long-dormant ice giant.
DescriptionLore: This artifact radiates intense cold. While holding it, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of frost. Each creature in a 30-foot radius centered on you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 cold damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its speed isn't reduced. After using this ability, the Frozen Heart becomes inert for 1d4 rounds, during which time you lose the resistance to cold damage.

Lore: Associated with ambitious Noxian artificers seeking to enhance mobility and burst damage. Could be linked to a secretive hextech research division.
DescriptionLore: This belt is a marvel of Noxian engineering. As an action, you can activate the rocketbelt to propel yourself 30 feet in a straight line towards a direction you choose. Any creature within 5 feet of your destination must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 fire damage. You are considered to have cast a spell to activate the belt for the purposes of counterspell, and it requires a spell slot of 3rd level. Once activated, the belt cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Favored by reavers and shipwrights, especially useful for claiming coastal territory and isolated outposts without drawing the full fleet's attention.
DescriptionLore: This magical maul grants +3 to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this maul, you can cast the spell 'Knock' at will. Additionally, when you hit a structure (such as a door, wall, or siege engine) with this maul, you deal triple damage to it. Once per long rest, you can unleash a thunderous strike against a structure. Make an attack roll against the structure's AC. On a hit, the structure takes 5d10 thunder damage and must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become vulnerable to all damage for 1 minute.

Lore: Forged in Bilgewater, associated with sea monster hunting. Grants the user the ability to take down any monstrosity in the seas.
DescriptionLore: This +3 spear is particularly effective against creatures of the deep. You gain advantage on attack rolls against aberrations and monstrosities that have a swimming speed. When you hit such a creature with this spear, it takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage. Furthermore, once per day, you can cast the spell 'Control Water' without expending a spell slot. When used against a Kraken, the spear deals an additional 6d6 damage and the Kraken has disadvantage on its saving throw against 'Control Water'.

Lore: Crafted by a Demacian weaponsmith to pierce even the thickest armor, it might have been used in wars against Noxus or the Freljord.
DescriptionLore: This +3 light crossbow ignores the Damage Resistance property of any creature. Furthermore, if you hit a creature with AC 18 or higher, that creature's AC is reduced by 1. This reduction lasts for 1 minute. The AC of a creature cannot be reduced below 18 in this way. In addition, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are larger than you.

Lore: Crafted with sands from Shurima and imbued with ancient magic, it offers protection against curses and debilitating magics.
DescriptionLore: This scimitar, forged from Shuriman sands and ancient magic, grants advantage on saving throws against being cursed or suffering from debilitating magical effects. While wielding this weapon, you are immune to the frightened condition.

Lore: Favored by Noxian duelists and executioners, its whisper erodes even the mightiest defenses, ensuring a swift end.
DescriptionLore: This Noxian blade whispers with malice. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have their Armor Class reduced by 2 until the end of your next turn. This reduction can stack.

Lore: Favored by duelists and dancers across Ionia, the Phantom Dancer is said to grant its wearer supernatural speed and grace.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this blade, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throws. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You then have advantage on attack rolls against the triggering creature until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Enhances ranged attacks, reminiscent of Ionian archers who imbue their shots with mystical energy for greater reach and impact.
DescriptionLore: This mystical longbow grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, the bowstring seems to hum with stored energy. As a bonus action, you can empower your next ranged attack with the bow to have its range doubled and deal an extra 2d6 force damage on a hit. This property can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses recharge at dawn.

Lore: Likely crafted by a forgotten Freljordian tribe, it evokes themes of protection and winter resilience, potentially tied to the Winter's Claw.
DescriptionLore: This intricately carved wooden sled radiates a faint aura of cold. While riding the Solstice Sleigh, you and up to two other Medium-sized creatures are immune to the effects of extreme cold, and you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can command the sleigh to glide effortlessly over snow and ice at a speed of 60 feet for 1 hour. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Associated with Ionian storm mages and the harnessing of raw magical energy into directed bursts, reminiscent of Ionian traditions.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon crackles with stored lightning. Once per long rest, as an action, you can unleash the Shiv's energy, targeting a point within 60 feet. Each creature within a 20-foot radius of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial power, potentially linked to the Aspect of the Twilight or the Aspect of War.
DescriptionLore: This weapon, blessed by celestial energies, allows you to channel the might of Targon. The first time you hit a creature with an attack on your turn, you can choose to deal an additional 4d8 radiant damage. If you do so, until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature and the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Lore: Associated with Demacian vanguard tactics, enabling swift and fortified advances. Could be connected to the Dauntless Vanguard.
DescriptionLore: While holding this item, you can, as a bonus action, create a path of solidified light. This path is 10 feet wide and up to 30 feet long, originating from you. The path remains for 1 minute. While on the path, you and any friendly creatures gain +10 feet to your movement speed and have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone. You can use this ability once per long rest.

Lore: Used by sentinels and mages of the White City, allowing greater reach and vigilance against threats both seen and unseen.
DescriptionLore: This stone pulses with a soft, inner light. While holding the Vigilant Wardstone, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks related to detecting hidden creatures or objects within 60 feet. Additionally, you can cast the *See Invisibility* spell once per day. The stone regains its ability to cast this spell at dawn.

Lore: Forged in the coldest reaches of the Freljord, it's said to ward off the chilling touch of the Watchers.
DescriptionLore: This item appears as a simple pendant made from a shard of true ice, perpetually cold to the touch. While wearing Winter's Approach, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of intense cold in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After using this ability, the pendant becomes inert until the next dawn.

Lore: Likely tied to the Void and the Watchers. Possibly a tool used by the Ascended in their battles against the Void.
DescriptionLore: This twisted, obsidian spike hums with an unsettling energy. While holding the Realmspike, you can cast the *Detect Magic* spell at will. Additionally, as an action, you can target one creature within 60 feet and force them to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is also vulnerable to psychic damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Associated with the Buhru tribe and sea monster hunting rituals of Bilgewater. Possibly used to appease or control sea beasts.
DescriptionLore: This wickedly barbed harpoon is a relic of the Buhru tribe, said to be blessed by Nagakabouros. Once per day, as an action, you can hurl Death's Daughter at a creature within 60 feet. Make a ranged attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 3d8 piercing damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward you. If the target is a beast of size Large or larger, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

Lore: Forged in the heart of a dying star, the Black Hole Gauntlet is rumored to be connected to the Aspect of the Void.
DescriptionLore: This gauntlet pulses with an unnatural darkness. While wearing the Black Hole Gauntlet, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. As an action, you can activate the gauntlet to create a miniature black hole at a point within 30 feet that you can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the point must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d10 force damage and is pulled 5 feet toward the center. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. The black hole collapses after one round. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Forged in the darkest Noxian forges, whispered to be infused with souls of conquered foes. Linked to the Black Rose.
DescriptionLore: These razor-sharp talons are crafted from darksteel and imbued with a fragment of trapped souls. While worn, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 slashing damage. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 soul to deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage and gain advantage on your next attack roll. These talons can hold a maximum of 5 souls. When you reduce a humanoid to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to trap its soul within the talons, granting the talons 1 soul. Souls fade from the talons at dawn.

Lore: Crafted by Noxian artificers, the Detonation Orb is rumored to utilize forbidden hemomancy for explosive power, favored by demolition squads.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with crimson energy. As an action, you can hurl the Detonation Orb up to 60 feet. Upon impact, the orb explodes in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage and 8d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of effect that is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is disintegrated. Once used, the orb turns to ash.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins and spies. Grants the wielder the element of surprise, negating an enemy's awareness.
DescriptionLore: This blade hums with shadows. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force them to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is Blinded and Deafened until the end of your next turn, and you gain advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of your next turn. Additionally, the first time you hit a creature with this weapon after emerging from being hidden or invisible, the attack deals an extra 4d6 necrotic damage.

Lore: Likely created by hemomancers in Noxus, Flesheater could be associated with the Black Rose or a warlord seeking power through blood magic.
DescriptionLore: This weapon thirsts for blood. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If you do, you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. Additionally, if you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

Lore: Favored by fortune tellers and swindlers alike. The blade is rumored to have been first owned by a card shark known as 'The River King'.
DescriptionLore: This +2 shortsword, once owned by the infamous card shark 'The River King', hums with chaotic energy. Once per long rest, when you make an attack roll with this weapon, you can choose to gamble. Roll a d20. On a 1-10, the attack automatically misses and you take 1d6 psychic damage. On an 11-20, the attack automatically hits and deals an extra 4d6 force damage.

Lore: Associated with the Kinkou Order, this jitte might have been wielded to maintain balance and discipline.
DescriptionLore: This +1 jitte grants advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is hit by an attack, you can redirect the chi flowing through the jitte, imposing disadvantage on the attack roll. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Crafted in the Shadow Isles, it drains the life force of enemies, possibly linked to the Black Mist's power.
DescriptionLore: This +2 scythe deals an additional 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the 'Enervation' spell (save DC 15) without expending a spell slot or material components.

Lore: A tool used by the Harrowing's reapers, it enhances their ability to collect souls. Connected to the Black Mist and spectral entities.
DescriptionLore: While holding this reaper's scythe, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul. The creature's soul is transferred to the scythe, and you can use a bonus action to release the soul, causing the scythe to deal an extra 6d6 necrotic damage on its next successful hit within 1 minute. The scythe can hold up to 3 souls at a time. When the scythe contains 3 souls, you can cast the 'Soul Cage' spell (no components required) as an action, consuming the souls in the scythe.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, rumored to briefly grant the wielder the aspect of the divine.
DescriptionLore: This longsword hums with celestial energy. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can invoke the divine aspect within the sword for 1 minute. While the aspect is invoked, you gain the following benefits: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this sword, you can deal an extra 3d8 radiant damage to the target. At the end of the minute, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Favored by temple archers, these items echo the teachings of precision and inner balance, principles deeply rooted in Ionian martial arts.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted longbow is always perfectly balanced in your hands. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. In addition, you gain the following benefits while wielding this bow: Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this bow, you can reroll one of the damage dice, choosing which result to use. As a bonus action, you can enter a state of heightened focus for 1 minute. While focused, your critical hit range with this bow is increased by 1 (to a maximum of 17-20).

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, rumored to offer protection against celestial wrath and the dangers of the ascent.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, you gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal radiant damage or originate from celestial beings. Additionally, once per day, when you would be reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point.

Lore: A hybrid weapon favored by those who blend magic and might, like Viktor. Potentially once belonging to a Hemomancer for blood magic.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a spell slot to deal an additional 1d8 force damage per level of the spell slot. In addition, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the force damage dealt. If you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target must also succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Forged by a forgotten aspect of Targon, the Wordless Promise binds two champions, sharing their burdens and bolstering their resolve.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this amulet, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer half of that damage to yourself. You can't reduce this transferred damage in any way. Additionally, when you are reduced to half your hit point maximum or lower, you and one willing creature within 30 feet of you both gain temporary hit points equal to your level in this class. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking swiftness in combat. The enchanted boots whisper forgotten techniques, enhancing reflexes and agility.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. In addition, as a bonus action, you can spend 1 Hit Die to gain advantage on your next attack roll or Dexterity check before the end of your turn.

Lore: Favored by Noxian scouts, the device is rumored to have been reverse-engineered from ancient Shuriman surveillance technology.
DescriptionLore: This handheld device has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast Detect Magic in a 60-foot cone. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to expend 1 charge and make a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to pinpoint the exact location of the nearest magical trap or illusion within 30 feet. The sweeper regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Potentially used by Demacian soldiers. Grants resilience and damage based on fortitude, embodying Demacian ideals.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws against effects that would inflict the frightened or charmed condition. Additionally, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

Lore: Likely tied to a Freljordian tribe known for raiding. The blade may have been used to plunder from rival tribes or outsiders.
DescriptionLore: This magical blade grants you advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are carrying gold or other valuable items. In addition, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you may choose to immediately search their person for any gold or other valuables; if you do, you regain 1d6 hit points.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist emanating from the Shadow Isles, potentially used by those who seek to manipulate its power.
DescriptionLore: This scythe deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to any target it hits. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, a wisp of black mist erupts from their body and swirls around you. For the next minute, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

Lore: Commonly used by mageseekers to quickly return to base after long missions, it is associated with Demacia's infrastructure and control.
DescriptionLore: Potion, very rare. When you drink this potion, you teleport to a safe location that you designate when you create the potion. This location must be within the same plane of existence as you and must be familiar to you. The potion has no effect if you are not on the same plane of existence as the designated location. Once designated, the location cannot be changed.

Lore: Worn by pit fighters and martial artists across Ionia, these gloves are rumored to be blessed by a forgotten spirit of perseverance.
DescriptionLore: Wondrous Item, rare (requires attunement). While wearing these gloves, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Additionally, once per day when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Noxian empire, it is rumored to have been wielded by a powerful warlord during the early expansions.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (greatsword), legendary (requires attunement). You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Noxian Might: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage to the target. If you do, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. The necrotic damage cannot be applied to constructs or undead.

Lore: Said to be crafted by long-lost seers from Mount Targon, this relic enhances one's ability to perceive hidden truths and foresee future events.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this artifact, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Intelligence (Investigation) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Augury spell without expending a spell slot.

Lore: Favored by Noxian alchemists, it enhances plague warfare, spreading virulent concoctions among their enemies.
DescriptionLore: This noxious vial contains enough material for three uses. As an action, you can hurl the vial up to 30 feet. On impact, the vial bursts, and each creature within a 10-foot radius must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, at the start of each of their turns, the poisoned creatures take 2d6 poison damage.

Lore: Said to be woven from captured starlight by the Solari, granting resilience against the night. Perhaps a relic from the Rune Wars.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this cloak, you have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on saving throws against effects that would turn you undead. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can cause the attacker to be blinded until the end of its next turn.

Lore: Drawn from the purest glacial springs, rumored to possess restorative properties known only to ancient ice witch covens. Used by hardy explorers.
DescriptionLore: This flask, hewn from glacial ice, contains a perpetually cool liquid. As an action, you can drink the flask's contents and regain 2d4 hit points. The flask magically refills with water after one minute if it is not inside an enclosed container. The flask can only be used three times, after which the restorative properties of the flask fade and it becomes a mundane, albeit beautiful, object.

Lore: Associated with forgotten Shadow Isles rituals and potent, but corrupting magic, the Deathfire Grasp was a tool for amplifying dark sorcery.
DescriptionLore: Wand, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). This twisted wand crackles with dark energy. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while holding this wand. As an action, you can expend 3 charges to unleash a burst of necrotic energy at one creature within 60 feet. The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this wand's effect has its soul trapped within the wand. The wand has 7 charges, and it regains 1d4+3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ash, releasing any trapped souls.

Lore: Implies a connection to consuming souls or life force, potentially linked to Mordekaiser or Thresh's artifacts.
DescriptionLore: Weapon (any), legendary (requires attunement). This weapon pulses with a ravenous hunger. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. While attuned to this weapon, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw at dawn each day or become cursed. While cursed, you are compelled to feed the weapon souls. You have disadvantage on all saving throws made to resist this compulsion. If you go 7 days without feeding the weapon a soul, you take 10d6 necrotic damage as the weapon feeds on your life force.

Lore: Crafted by a forgotten order of Ionian mages, rumored to enhance the user's connection to the spirit realm and the magic within.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this ring, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to interact with spirits or creatures from other planes of existence.

Lore: The Edge of Finality hums with the echoes of spirit realm blades. Perfected by Ionian weapon masters.
DescriptionLore: This magical longsword deals an extra 2d8 force damage on a hit. Once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul within the blade. While a soul is trapped, you can use a bonus action to unleash it, dealing 6d8 force damage to a target within 30 feet. The soul is then released.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the elixir is rumored to grant temporary invincibility, emboldening warriors before entering the arena.
DescriptionLore: For the next minute after drinking this elixir, you are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. After the minute ends, you gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: The Equinox is likely connected to the celestial bodies watched over by the Solari and Lunari of Mount Targon.
DescriptionLore: This mysterious artifact pulses with the combined energy of the sun and moon. While holding the Equinox, you gain advantage on saving throws against being blinded or frightened. Additionally, once per dawn or dusk, you can unleash a burst of celestial energy, dealing 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures within a 15-foot radius. The damage is halved for creatures that succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw.

Lore: Implies a connection to ascended beings of Shurima, suggesting potential for transformation or enhanced power linked to the sun disc.
DescriptionLore: This ancient Shuriman relic holds the potential to unlock your inner Ascended. As an action, you can touch the Eye of Ascension and make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a success, you gain the benefits of the 'enlarge' portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 hour, and your skin takes on a sun-kissed bronze hue. On a failure, you are stunned until the end of your next turn as the Eye attempts to reshape you. If you attempt this transformation again within 7 days, the DC increases by 2.

Lore: Associated with the Solari, forging light into a protective ward. Perhaps a relic from a forgotten age on Mount Targon.
DescriptionLore: A relic of the Solari, this item radiates a comforting warmth. While holding the Eye of the Equinox, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks that deal radiant damage. As a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is hit by such an attack, you can expend 1 charge to grant resistance to radiant damage to the target of the attack until the end of their next turn. The Eye has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Forged on Targon, this item likely has connections to the Solari or the Rakkor, embodying protection and resilience.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can grant them temporary hit points equal to your level in that class. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Lore: Whispers say the Flicker was crafted by a forgotten order in Ionia, tied to the spirit realm and rapid translocation.
DescriptionLore: This amulet allows you to cast the Misty Step spell at will. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet. If you do so, the next attack roll made against you before the end of your next turn has disadvantage.

Lore: May be related to Lissandra or another Ice Witch. Grants ghostly apparitions and slows foes.
DescriptionLore: This spectral diadem allows you to cast the 'Hold Person' spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Furthermore, as an action, you can summon two spectral apparitions that appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of you. These apparitions have a speed of 30 feet and can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command one apparition to attempt to slow a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have its speed halved until the end of its next turn. The apparitions disappear after 1 minute or if reduced to 0 hit points (they have 1 hit point each).

Lore: May be associated with Iceborn, wielding frozen power. Perhaps wielded by Lissandra's loyal followers or ancient Frostguard warriors.
DescriptionLore: This gauntlet, when worn, grants you resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a cone of frost extending 15 feet from you. Creatures in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 cold damage and have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn. You can use this ability three times, regaining all expended uses after a long rest. While attuned to this item, you can cast the 'Armor of Agathys' spell once per long rest, without expending a spell slot.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, it whispers tales of ancient frost giants and forgotten winters.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this shroud, you are immune to the effects of extreme cold and gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal cold damage. In addition, once per day, as an action, you can summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, heavily obscuring the area and imposing disadvantage on ranged attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. At the end of each of your turns while the blizzard persists, each creature within the area takes 2d6 cold damage.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment through secluded meditation and observation of the spirit realm.
