DescriptionLore: While holding this totem, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. As an action, you can plant the totem in the ground. For the next hour, any creature within 30 feet of the totem gains the benefits of the Pass Without Trace spell. Once this effect ends, the totem crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be imbued with the spirits of ancient frost mages, forever seeking worthy warriors.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longsword. When you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become encased in ice. While encased, the creature is restrained and has vulnerability to fire damage. At the end of each of its turns, the encased creature can repeat the saving throw, freeing itself on a success. On a critical hit, the target is permanently frozen solid.

Lore: Rumored to be recovered from a Sunken Temple of Nagakabouros, favored by fortune hunters and those seeking quick riches in the port cities.
DescriptionLore: While you wear this amulet, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Charisma (Persuasion) checks made when interacting with merchants or pirates. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Locate Object spell. When you cast the spell in this way, you only locate gold coins or items made of gold. While attuned to the heart of gold, once per week, you can choose to have up to 1000 gold pieces magically appear in your hand.

Lore: Associated with Viktor and the Glorious Evolution, enhancing the user's mechanical capabilities. Commonly seen among Zaun's techmaturge.
DescriptionLore: This arcane device hums with untapped potential. As an action, you can attach the Hex Core to a willing construct, or humanoid creature that has mechanical body parts. The target gains a +2 bonus to their AC, and they gain resistance to either lightning or poison damage (their choice). Additionally, they can cast the Shocking Grasp cantrip at will, and can use an action to cast the Lightning Bolt spell (3rd level) once per day. Once per week, the attuned creature can use an action to cast the Animate Objects spell.

Lore: Associated with early Noxian artificers, seeking to weaponize magic for the empire's expansion. Could be related to Mordekaiser's research.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus, once wielded by Noxian artificers, hums with latent magical energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Shocking Grasp cantrip (save DC 13) or expend 3 charges to cast Magic Missile as a 1st level spell. The revolver has 7 charges and regains 1d4+3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the revolver shatters into inert fragments.

Lore: Likely used by foragers and hunters of the Freljord seeking to survive the harsh wilderness and monster encounters.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4+2 hit points. For the next hour, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures, and on attack rolls against beasts and monstrosities whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level. The effects end early if you take damage from a creature that is not a beast or monstrosity.

Lore: A draught favored by the Reckoners, rumored to be distilled from the blood of fallen gladiators. Enhances aggression and power.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this viscous, crimson fluid, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute: You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +3 bonus to the damage roll (included in the attack). At the end of each of your turns, you take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage that cannot be reduced in any way. Afterwards, you gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Forged by a forgotten Ionian sect, the Ionic Spark was used to defend against shadow magic. Now, only echoes of its power remain.
DescriptionLore: While holding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate the Spark, causing it to emit a crackling aura of energy for 1 minute. While the aura is active, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 lightning damage. The Spark can be used three times, and regains all expended uses at dawn.

Lore: Favored by fortune tellers and gamblers across Bilgewater, believing it brought them luck in their ventures.
DescriptionLore: While you possess this item, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can choose to treat the roll as a 20.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, rumored to enhance the life-stealing abilities of those who wield it, possibly tied to ancient Hemomancy practices.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Once per long rest, as a reaction when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, the next attack you make with this weapon before the end of your next turn has advantage and deals an extra 3d6 necrotic damage.

Lore: Whispers claim it was forged in the Immortal Bastion, fueled by hemomancy. Its previous owners met gruesome ends, their life essence drained.
DescriptionLore: This terrifying artifact pulses with dark energy. While holding the Leeching Leer, you can use a bonus action to target one creature within 30 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 5d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and you regain no hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the start of your next turn. In addition, any creature that touches the Leeching Leer takes 2d6 necrotic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the Leeching Leer has its life essence completely drained away and cannot be revived by any means short of a wish spell.

Lore: Favored by Demacian rangers, this item enhances precision. Used by elite trackers.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted longbow is a masterwork of Demacian craftsmanship. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with this bow, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target and the next attack roll against the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

Lore: Favored by captains and sea monsters alike, the Leviathan was a sign of dominance on the high seas, often adorned with trophies.
DescriptionLore: This colossal greatsword radiates the power of the deep sea. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a charge to unleash a wave of seawater dealing an additional 4d8 cold damage and pushing the target 10 feet away. This weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and you can breathe underwater.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial entities of Targon, offering protection against the harshest conditions.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this pendant, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and resistance to cold and fire damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can touch the pendant to regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Crafted by the legendary smith, Dominik, it is said to be blessed by the sun, allowing the wielder to pierce even the mightiest armor.
DescriptionLore: This legendary weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, and that creature's AC is 18 or higher, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage. If the target is wearing heavy armor, the extra damage increases to 3d6 radiant damage. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to call forth the sun's blessing, granting you advantage on attack rolls against armored opponents for 1 minute.

Lore: Resonates with the ancient magic of Ionia, amplifying the wearer's spells, reminiscent of a powerful echo mage.
DescriptionLore: This arcane focus grants a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spell's damage is echoed, dealing an extra 2d6 force damage to one additional target within 30 feet of the original target. The extra target is chosen by you. This additional damage can only occur once per casting of a spell.

Lore: Associated with a Noxian artificer who sought to weaponize hemomancy. The item was lost after an experiment went awry.
DescriptionLore: This weapon pulses with dark energy. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d6 necrotic damage. If the creature has blood, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. A creature is immune if it doesn't have blood or is undead.

Lore: Whispers say it was crafted in the Shadow Isles, fueled by tormented spirits, twisting minds and bodies alike. It is associated with corruption.
DescriptionLore: This cursed item radiates an aura of unease. When a creature attunes to Malady, they must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become afflicted with a madness. While attuned, the user has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks, but disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the spell 'Inflict Wounds' as a 5th-level spell, requiring no material components.

Lore: Likely originating from the Shadow Isles, the Mandrake Ward could be associated with necromantic magic or entities manipulating perception and fear.
DescriptionLore: This gnarled wooden ward pulses with necromantic energy. As an action, you can plant the Mandrake Ward in the ground. For the next hour, all creatures within a 30-foot radius must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours. The ward crumbles to dust after an hour or after being successfully dispelled.

Lore: Whispers speak of a pact made with dark entities, granting strength but risking demonic influence, potentially linked to Mordekaiser's dominion.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this weapon, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level in the class that granted you the most recent level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once this effect is triggered, it cannot be used again until you complete a long rest. However, after each long rest, roll a d20. On a result of 1, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Favored by captains navigating treacherous seas, it offers protection against curses and shadowy entities, common in the waters around Bilgewater.
DescriptionLore: This +2 scimitar has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Dispel Magic spell (DC 15). In addition, while you wield this scimitar, you have advantage on saving throws against curses and effects that would turn you into an undead creature. The scimitar regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Forged by Ionian spiritwalkers, its illusions confuse foes, reminiscent of the trickster spirits of the forests, reflecting Ionian adaptability and misdirection.
DescriptionLore: This +1 shortsword has 3 charges. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Mirror Image spell. While wielding this blade, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in lightly obscured areas. The shortsword regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial light of Targon, channeling the moon's restorative energies to aid allies in need.
DescriptionLore: While holding this Moonstone Renewer, you can use a bonus action to touch a creature within 30 feet. That creature regains hit points equal to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature, you can choose a different creature within 30 feet of the target. The chosen creature regains hit points equal to 1d6.

Lore: Whispers say Murksphere was used by a forgotten order in the Shadow Isles to contain malevolent spirits.
DescriptionLore: This orb pulses with an unnatural darkness. As an action, you can hurl the Murksphere at a point within 60 feet. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failed save, a creature also takes 3d6 psychic damage. Once this property is used, the Murksphere becomes nonmagical for 24 hours.

Lore: Said to be forged in the heart of the Shadow Isles, it pulses with the essence of tormented spirits, granting power at a terrible price.
DescriptionLore: This dark blade hungers for life force. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If the creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to half your hit point maximum or lower, you can regain hit points equal to 4d8 + your Constitution modifier. After using this feature, you gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Favored by frost archers of the Freljord, Noonquiver aids in hunting massive beasts across the frozen tundra.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this quiver, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with ranged weapons that use ammunition drawn from it. In addition, as a bonus action, you can imbue up to three arrows drawn from the quiver with frost. When an arrow imbued this way hits a creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the creature also suffers disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn if it attempts to move before then.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, it allows for swift strikes and ruthless efficiency in eliminating high-value targets.
DescriptionLore: This dagger grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, once per turn, if you have advantage on an attack roll against a creature, you can choose to deal an extra 14 (4d6) necrotic damage to the target. If you do so, you gain advantage on Stealth checks until the end of your next turn as dark shadows obscure your movements.

Lore: Favored by those who seek hidden truths on Mount Targon. Used by the guides that explore the mountain's treacherous paths.
DescriptionLore: While holding this lens, you can use a bonus action to cast the Detect Magic spell. The lens has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, when you cast the Detect Magic spell using this lens, you can also choose to cast See Invisibility as part of the same action, consuming one additional charge.

Lore: Favored by duelists and those who value agility, the Phantom Dancer is often associated with Ionian martial traditions.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this vestment, your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. It also grants you the following benefits: You gain a +2 bonus to AC. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to become invisible until the end of your next turn. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Lore: Vastayan smiths in the Freljord use enchanted pickaxes to mine True Ice, the only substance believed capable of forging weapons that can strike a god.
DescriptionLore: This magical pickaxe grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made against objects and structures. When used to mine any metal, the wielder gains advantage on checks made to determine the quality and quantity of the mined ore. Against creatures composed of ice or cold, this pickaxe deals an additional 2d6 fire damage. Once per day, the wielder can cast the 'Shatter' spell (DC 15) centered on a point they can see within 60 feet.

Lore: Favored by Demacian soldiers, these boots offer protection against both physical blows and magical assaults.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. As a bonus action, you can stomp the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot radius centered on yourself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Lore: Favored by resourceful captains and cunning merchants to quickly redeploy ships and crews, or escape from dangerous waters.
DescriptionLore: This small, intricately carved pad allows for near-instantaneous teleportation of seagoing vessels. As an action, you can touch the pad to a ship of Large size or smaller. That ship, along with all creatures and objects aboard, instantly teleports to a predetermined location associated with this pad. The destination must be within 500 miles and a known, fixed location you have visited previously. The Port Pad can only be used once per day, and its destination can be changed by performing a 24-hour ritual at the desired new location.

Lore: Likely used by early explorers of Shurima, seeking hidden tombs and resources beneath the sands. Perhaps belonging to a member of the Ascended.
DescriptionLore: This ring, crafted from sun-baked gold and etched with ancient Shuriman glyphs, grants its wearer advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate deserts and Wisdom (Perception) checks to locate hidden doors, traps, and passages within ruins and tombs. Additionally, once per day, the wearer can cast the Locate Object spell, requiring no components, to find a specific object made of metal or stone within 1 mile. If the ring belonged to an Ascended, it might possess additional, yet dormant, powers waiting to be unlocked.

Lore: Favored by Ionian archers seeking to strike with precision and speed, enhancing their ranged attacks.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted longbow hums with latent energy. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, the bowstring vibrates, enhancing the shot's power. The bow has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can focus its energy, causing your next successful ranged attack with it to have its range doubled and deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage.

Lore: Often found near spirit blossom festivals, rumored to contain essence from the spirit realm enhancing vitality.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this potion, you regain 8d4 hit points. For the next hour, you gain advantage on saving throws against disease and poison, and your exhaustion level, if any, is decreased by one.

Lore: Associated with the Solari, celestial power is imbued within. Grants its user some of this godly strength.
DescriptionLore: While holding this amulet, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength and Charisma checks and saving throws. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to call upon the celestial power within, granting you advantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. Once this bonus action is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Enhances the wearer's spells, perhaps linked to ancient Ionian spirit magic or forgotten techniques.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, the first time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on each of your turns, one target of the spell takes an extra 1d6 thunder damage. This damage increases to 2d6 if the spell requires an attack roll and the attack roll is a critical hit.

Lore: Likely crafted by a hemomancer of Noxus, possibly connected to the Black Rose or Vladimir, focusing on blood magic.
DescriptionLore: This ancient Noxian scroll contains a powerful ritual of hemomancy. When cast, using a willing or incapacitated creature, you can sacrifice up to 6 hit dice from it. For each hit die sacrificed, the ritual's cast time is increased by 10 minutes. Choose one of the following effects: Restore hit points to yourself equal to the maximum value of the die; Instantly deal necrotic damage to a creature within 60 feet equal to double the maximum value of the die; Create a blood construct with hit points equal to 5 times the maximum value of the die that obeys your commands for 30 days; Enhance your weapon attacks with necrotic energy, dealing an extra 1d6 necrotic damage per sacrificed hit die for 1 year.

Lore: Enchanted blade, imbued with spirit magic. Associated with Ionian monks seeking balance and harmony through martial prowess and arcane study.
DescriptionLore: This exquisitely crafted glaive hums with Ionian spirit energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, once per day, as a bonus action, you can imbue the glaive with arcane power for 1 minute. While imbued, the glaive deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage on a hit, and you can use your action to unleash a wave of spirit energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead and fiends have disadvantage on this saving throw.

Lore: The compass may be related to ancient Freljordian navigation techniques or a relic of a lost tribe, possibly connected with Lissandra.
DescriptionLore: This ancient compass, etched with Freljordian runes, always points towards the nearest source of powerful elemental magic. The compass has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend a charge and ask the compass a question related to finding a specific location or object imbued with elemental power. The compass will then guide you towards the answer for the next hour, granting you advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track or navigate towards the source. Furthermore, while holding the compass, you are resistant to cold damage and have advantage on saving throws against being lost or disoriented due to magical effects.

Lore: Whispers say it was crafted by an ascetic order devoted to the stars, seeking to emulate celestial benevolence.
The pup's fiery claws hint at a connection to the volcanic vents deep within the Freljord. Perhaps it is related to a forgotten fire god.
Favored by Noxian admirals and generals, it represents strategic authority and martial strength, often seen in command tents or on flagships.
Favored by Bilgewater's most cutthroat hunters, its venomous bite is said to have been inspired by the creatures of the deep, designed to strip away any defense.
DescriptionLore: This dagger grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, if the target has a magical shield or barrier active (such as from the Shield spell or a similar effect), that effect is immediately dispelled. Additionally, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against spells for 1 minute.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have belonged to a disgraced warlord, its magic offers resilience, but at a cost.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this armguard, you gain a +2 bonus to AC and advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. This item is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the armguard.

Lore: Said to amplify the will of the wielder, Shurelya's Requiem is rumored to originate from the Solari during a time of great need.
DescriptionLore: While holding this amulet, you can use an action to grant yourself and all allies within 30 feet a burst of speed. For the next minute, each affected creature's movement speed is doubled, and they gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws. Once used, this property of the amulet cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, while attuned to this amulet, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, Sightstones are imbued with celestial energy, granting vision where the mortal eye cannot perceive.
DescriptionLore: This smooth, milky stone pulses with a faint, inner light. While holding the Sightstone, you can cast the 'Detect Magic' spell at will, and you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight within 30 feet. As an action, you can expend a charge (recharges 1d4-1 charges at dawn) to cast the 'Clairvoyance' spell, requiring no material components. The stone emits dim light in a 5-foot radius while in use.

Lore: Whispers say a hedge wizard in Ionia enchants boots for nimble students, granting bursts of speed. Perhaps a connection to the Kinkou Order?
DescriptionLore: While wearing these supple leather boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Once per short rest, as a bonus action, you can activate the boots to double your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line using this doubled speed, you can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against a creature within range at the end of your movement.

Lore: Bound to restless spirits, it echoes the Shadow Isles' sorrow, perhaps linked to the Ruination or lost souls seeking solace.
DescriptionLore: This heavy, iron anchor radiates a chilling aura. While holding it, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can slam the Soul Anchor into the ground. For the next minute, all undead creatures within 30 feet of the anchor have disadvantage on attack rolls and must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to move more than 10 feet away from the anchor on their turn. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: Associated with restless spirits and the magic of the Shadow Isles, potentially used to siphon life force or manipulate spectral energies.
DescriptionLore: This sickle, when wielded against an undead creature, deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. Additionally, once per long rest, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this sickle, you can choose to trap its soul. The creature cannot be resurrected except by a wish spell or similar magic, and you gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw within the next hour.

Lore: Favored by those who siphon power from the weak, it may be associated with Lisandra's frostguard, or potentially even a tribe using dark ice.
DescriptionLore: While holding this dagger, whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose one creature damaged by the spell to suffer disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC.

Lore: Associated with ancient Ionian monasteries, enhancing spiritual resilience and healing practices. Monks often use it to meditate and enhance their natural Ki.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this mask, you have resistance to necrotic damage and you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, whenever you regain hit points from a spell or magical effect, you regain additional hit points equal to 1d6. This bonus increases to 2d6 if you are in your own plane of existence.

Lore: Associated with the now-defunct Stark family of Noxus, known for their brutal efficiency in warfare and their fervor in battle.
DescriptionLore: This Noxian warhammer was forged for the Stark family. While wielding this hammer, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can unleash a wave of raw aggression, granting yourself advantage on all attack rolls until the end of your next turn and enemies within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Lore: Whispers claim it channels celestial storms, favored by Aspect hosts seeking to overwhelm mortal foes. Connections to the Solari are suspected.
DescriptionLore: This Targon-forged staff crackles with celestial energy. You gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Once per day, as an action, you can cast Chain Lightning (8th level) without expending a spell slot. After casting Chain Lightning in this way, roll a d6. On a 1, the staff loses its magic and becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

Lore: Said to be forged from the light of a collapsing star. Prized by the Solari for its celestial power and connection to the Aspects.
DescriptionLore: This radiant longsword pulses with starlight. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As an action, you can unleash a burst of celestial energy, forcing each creature within 15 feet of you to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Lore: A parasitic entity from the Shadow Isles, possibly related to the Black Mist or a forgotten spirit. Feeds on the life force of its host.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, you are immune to being charmed or possessed. Additionally, as an action, you can attempt to drain the life force of a creature within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. While attuned, you have disadvantage on all Charisma checks not directed at undead.

Lore: Likely crafted by an ancient Ice Witch, possibly Lissandra, its magic has faded with time, becoming a shadow of its former power.
DescriptionLore: This dagger is a relic of a bygone age, radiating a faint chill. While holding the dagger, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a burst of frost. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this save also has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. The dagger has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Possibly connected to an ancient Aspect or celestial being of Targon. Its age suggests a forgotten era of cosmic influence.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this talisman, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and saving throws. Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to be healed for 2d8 + your Wisdom modifier hit points instead. If you do, a beam of faint starlight descends upon you from the heavens. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened while you are at or above half of your maximum hit points.

Lore: The elixir's ingredients are rumored to be sourced from the Spirit Blossom festival, enhancing magical prowess for a brief time.
DescriptionLore: When you drink this elixir, you regain one expended spell slot. The spell slot can be of 3rd level or lower. The elixir has no effect if you have no expended spell slots. For the next hour, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against spells and magical effects. After 1 hour, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Forged with ancient Ionian techniques, it is said to amplify the wielder's innate abilities. Associated with the spirit realm.
DescriptionLore: This magical weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 3 ki points to deal an extra 3d10 force damage to the target and regain hit points equal to the force damage dealt. You can only use this ability once per turn.

Lore: Likely created in Zaun by Viktor or one of his followers. It appears to be a Hextech device modified with unique chemicals.
DescriptionLore: This device has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend one charge to unleash a burst of energy, creating one of the following effects: 1) Fire a beam that deals 8d6 lightning damage in a 60-foot line, 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking half damage on a success. 2) Release a cloud of noxious gas in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 3) Unleash a wave of concussive force, pushing all creatures within 15 feet of you 15 feet away. Creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The device regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Legends say a tempestuous spirit was bound within it by a forgotten Ionian sect, granting the wielder incredible speed and agility.
DescriptionLore: While wielding Typhoon, you gain the following benefits: Your speed increases by 30 feet. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. As a bonus action, you can summon a whirlwind in a 10-foot radius around you. Creatures within the whirlwind have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. The whirlwind lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Favored by those who dance among the stars, granting ethereal lightness and swiftness to reach ever higher celestial realms.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this aeropack, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, you can cast the Feather Fall spell at will. As an action, you can activate the aeropack's enhanced thrusters, granting you a flying speed of 120 feet and the ability to hover for 1 minute. After using the enhanced thrusters, the aeropack requires 1 hour to recharge.

Lore: Crafted in Demacia, rumored to ward against rogue mages or creatures of the void. The barrier instills courage against magical threats.
DescriptionLore: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by a spell, you can expend 1 of the shield's 3 charges to grant the target advantage on the saving throw against the spell. The shield regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Used by Demacian scouts to maintain vigilance against Sylas' mageseekers. Also favored by Garen's Dauntless Vanguard for reconnaissance.
DescriptionLore: This small, magically-infused stone can be planted as an action. It emits bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. While active, the ward grants advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect invisible or obscured creatures and objects within its radius. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. It lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check to dispel the ward early.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, imbued with relentless aggression. Favored by Darius, it amplifies martial prowess and dominance on the battlefield.
DescriptionLore: This weapon pulses with barely contained rage. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. On a failed save, you can immediately make one additional weapon attack against the prone target as a reaction.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian executioners, rumored to be stained with the essence of countless betrayals and dark pacts.
DescriptionLore: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic hatchet. Once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Also, the first time on each of your turns that you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

Lore: Likely crafted by the Iceborn, it resonates with the magic of the Freljord and is tied to increasing one's resilience and defense.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this amulet, you gain resistance to cold damage. Additionally, you can use an action to summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, lightly obscures the area, and creatures within the blizzard have their movement speed halved. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energy, amplifying bonds between allies and echoing ancient pacts.
DescriptionLore: This amulet has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to grant one creature you can see within 30 feet of you the benefits of the *Bless* spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). Additionally, if you or an ally within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 2 charges as a reaction to instead drop to 1 hit point. The amulet regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Lore: Said to ward off spirits, Wriggle's Lantern was once used by sentinels to navigate the Shadow Isles. It is now lost.
DescriptionLore: This lantern sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While holding the lantern, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or possessed by undead. As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you that is invisible, ethereal, or shapechanged. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become visible, corporeal, or revert to its true form for 1 minute. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Lore: Worn by elite Kinkou Order trainees. Enhances agility and grounding, essential for maintaining balance in spiritual and physical combat.
DescriptionLore: While wearing these boots, your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone or moved against your will.

Lore: Likely tied to the spirit of Youmuu, a restless soul haunting the Shadow Isles, seeking vengeance.
DescriptionLore: This spectral blade hums with restless energy. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can unleash Youmuu's Wrath for 1 minute. While Youmuu's Wrath is active, your movement speed is doubled, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. At the end of Youmuu's Wrath, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists valuing swiftness, embodying balance between speed and precision, reflecting Ionian martial philosophies.
DescriptionLore: While attuned to this item, your base walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and Dexterity saving throws as long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield. As a reaction when you are targeted by a melee attack, you can move up to your speed away from the attacker, negating the attack.

Lore: Potentially forged by the Ice Witch, or granted to followers of the Three Sisters. Grants frost powers.
DescriptionLore: While wearing this herald, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of frost, forcing each creature in a 30-foot cone to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 cold damage and has its speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't have its speed reduced. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

Lore: Presumably crafted by, or in honor of, the ancient Shuriman artificer, Zhonya. In theory, it's a device that can stop time.
DescriptionLore: This intricate golden device allows you to briefly manipulate time. As an action, you can activate Zhonya's Paradox, encasing yourself in a temporal stasis for 1 round. During this time, you are petrified, and you are immune to all damage and effects, but you also cannot take any actions, move, or be moved. After the round ends, you return to normal. Once used, Zhonya's Paradox cannot be used again until 7 days have passed.

Lore: Likely tied to ancient Shuriman constructs or void-touched experiments gone awry. May be a relic of the Rune Wars.
DescriptionLore: This fist-sized stone pulsates with otherworldly energy. As an action, you can place the Zz'Rot Portal on any unoccupied space within 10 feet. The portal lasts for 1 minute, or until destroyed (AC 15, 30 hit points, immune to psychic and poison damage). Each round, at the start of your turn, the portal summons 1d3 Voidmites. These creatures are loyal to you and obey your commands. After the portal disappears, it crumbles to dust and cannot be used again.
